events.name: #161 [Intermediate] Setting up a hosted Ethereum node (#2)
events.description:
In the last workshop we set up an Ethereum node on a virtual hosted server.
It's a quick catch-up if you missed it, but we'll continue to enhance the deployment with APIs, website, etc.

Previous write-up...
In this workshop we'll be setting up a node (or few) roughly following [https://github.com/bokkypoobah/BokkysCheatsheet/wiki/Ethereum-Node-Setup-On-A-Virtual-Server](these instructions), and documenting updated steps along the way.

Chat history from workshop Telegram channel:
"ETH Mainnet node on Linode 16Gb 6 Cores 320 GB SSD 8 TB transfers USD 80/mo.
Ropsten node on Linode 8Gb 4 Cores 160 GB SSD 5 TB transfers USD 40/mo."
https://www.linode.com/pricing/

Currently looking at AWS t2.xlarge 4 vCPUs 16Gb for Ropsten
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/

Q: Less than 300 user transactrions a week?
A: If you are comfortable running your own virtual server, Linode 1Gb 1 Core 25 Gb SSD USD 5/mo will do.

To help cover the costs of food/drink, please bring a donation. Recommended $20/$10 note if you can, or almost can, afford it. (no worries if you can't)

---

Notes
• Workshops are often recorded for educational purposes and to eventually put online. Attendance is taken as consent.
• PSA: Please be mindful of open source and open community etiquettes. (eg, attributing the source of works that you build upon, and not "stealing" another person's project/idea for commercial gains)

---

Housekeeping:
• Meet 10 minutes before the start at 17:20, in the lobby of 155 Clarence Street, Sydney
• If arriving later, please ping the BokkyPooBah's Ethereum Workshop Chat (https://t.me/joinchat/Ep-XOkwa_umKWXXRBGBVVQ) group and someone will come down to get you
• There will be some refreshments. Donations to cover expenses: $20 (those who can afford it), $10 (those who can almost afford it), $0 (those who really cannot afford it).
• The topic details for these workshops can change up to the last minute
• If you have successfully RSVPed or are on the waitlist, please review your RSVP status and cancel your RSVP/waitlist ASAP if you cannot make it to free up the spot for other people
• People from Tyro do not have to RSVP

events.name: Ethereum Belgium Meetup : 3 decentralized web3 applications you can use today
events.description:
For our next meetup we will look at 3 very concrete use cases you can use today on the public Ethereum network:

- 3Box (https://3box.io/) is a decentralized platform that provides storage, messaging, social profile & sign-in. It progressed so fast that it can now reproduce the core feature of Facebook (https://medium.com/3box/introducing-3box-wall-7c299f4e0a1d) while you keep full control over your data.
- ENS (https://ens.domains/) domain name services (registry, registrars, and public resolvers) but based on Ethereum & with superpowers.
- Monolith (https://monolith.xyz/) an open-source, non-custodial, decentralised "bank" account base on Ethereum that come with a ... VISA card.

So after the usual 5 minutes introduction to Ethereum, We will look a those services both from the functional & technical point of view.

Of course drinks, food & stickers are forseen !

PS : you can also register on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ethereum-belgium-3-decentralized-web3-applications-you-can-use-today-tickets-84599073105

#BUIDLnetwork #Blockchain #Ethereum #Web3

events.description:
PLEASE RSVP HERE TOO: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/100x-your-dapp-on-ethereum-skale-singapore-tickets-85053265607

Hello Singapore! SKALE is excited to partner with StakeWith.US and ETH Singapore for this workshop.

About this Event
Join us if you want to learn how to make your dApps run at 100x the mainnet speed while staying fully decentralized.

In this workshop, you will learn how to deploy your Ethereum DApp to SKALE using your favorite developer tools (Truffle, Web3.js, ...) and run it with zero delays and subsecond block times in a completely gas-free environment.

Christine Perry, SKALE VP of Solutions Engineering, will explain SKALE technology and show how to build dApps on Ethereum + SKALE.

Agenda:

7.00 - 7.30 pm - Check-in, pizza, drinks, networking

7.30 - 8.15 pm - SKALE DApp Deployment workshop by Christine Perry

8.15 - 8.30 pm - Q&A

8.30 - 9.00 pm - More pizza and networking

Speaker:

Christine Perry

VP Solutions Engineering, SKALE Labs

http://skale.network/

Bio: Christine manages the customer success journey both pre and post-sales. This includes developing custom integrations, prototypes, delivering technical workshops and working with dApp developers and leading ecosystem growth projects.

SKALE Network:

The SKALE Network is an elastic, modular network of blockchains built with cutting edge threshold cryptography and containerization technology. The result is an easy-to-use, secure, fast, cost-effective decentralized cloud. With SKALE, dApps can deploy their own blockchain and configure it to their unique requirements.

events.name: TEM 基礎教育課程第三階段：「跨出工程師只會寫 Code 的既有框架」
events.description:
想要了解區塊鏈技術，你一定聽過鼎鼎大名的台灣第一大的區塊鏈社群-台北以太坊，Taipei Eetherum Meetup 從 2016 年開始就默默地投注各種資源到社群裡，舉辦不下 50 場免費實體活動與實作工作坊，邀請研究者、開發者、國際公司來台分享。Medium 上累積了 162 篇專業文章與近 3000 名訂閱用戶。Taipei Ethereum Meetup 持續透過各種形式讓產業知識快速流通，培養台灣優秀區塊鏈人才，期許能夠對台灣有所貢獻。2019 年 10 月，更盛大舉辦 Crosslink 2019，邀請以太坊生態圈重磅講者到台灣與當地社群面對面交流。

請至活動通網頁報名 https://www.accupass.com/event/1911150750032715966110

【這堂課程是什麼？為什麼要開這門課？】

本課程著重在進入區塊鏈產業所需具備的基礎知識。

區塊鏈的技術是橫跨多領域所組成，並又接著在各領域知識的基礎上創新。從網路結構的外觀來看，系統以眾多節點以點對點架構組成，相異於主流日常生活用的網路服務的主從式架構。節點間對資料取得共識的機制也須追溯到分散式系統的研究。

在以太坊以來，客製化虛擬機以進行運算也成顯學，這塊又屬於編譯器的領域知識。不論在共識層或應用層，系統倚賴密碼學的工具。最後利用區塊鏈簿記上的資產進行獎勵或懲罰來讓系統參與者作出行動，需要經濟學上的工具。

即使在五年之前進入區塊鏈圈，要能夠一次把這所有的領域接觸過也非容易。這次課程取得在各自領域專精的講者，把每個領域重要的概念提過，並點出與區塊鏈關聯的重點。目標並非讓學習者能夠完全掌握所有的領域，而是

- 降低日後自行學習的障礙，知道可以從哪裡開始看
- 知道哪些領域有學習者自己領域能夠切入合作的缺口
- 知道各種領域的瓶頸及前沿研究是什麼

課程的安排除了前述眾領域的介紹，最後有一門「客戶端原始碼分析」，全節點便是整個抽象共識機制的具體軟體實作，有了前面的基礎，看到程式碼會比較知道背後設計的原因。

【講者是誰？】

此次邀請到的講者都在區塊鏈技術中至少深耕一年以上，對各自專精的議題已有獨到見解。

梁智程｜Ethereum Asia Pacific Limited 以太坊基金會研究員

戴宏穎 (海帶)｜Second State VP of engineering

林修平｜Ethereum Asia Pacific Limited 以太坊基金會研究員

邱駿 (Juin)｜Unitychain Lead Researcher

吳偉誠 (Kimi)｜Unitychain Developer

賈脈瑄｜Ethereum Asia Pacific Limited 以太坊基金會研究員

Miya Chen｜帳聯網路科技 (AMIS) Developer

【為什麼從以太坊開始學？】

以太坊鏈上的 Dapp ，不論是在數量或是應用的範圍上，皆遙遙領先其他主鏈。各大主流區塊鏈應用的衍生，也是以以太坊為基礎發展而成。 以太坊目前仍是區塊鏈中最具開源文化的生態系之一，技術支援也是所有公鏈中最完整的，有著最豐富的研究者社群與概念創新。

【課程時數與費用】

課程將分成三階段，每階段授課 12 小時，形式包含講課與實作。
每一階段 12 小時收費 $4,800 元，早鳥票 $3,600，三人團報價 $3,000/1 人。
課程人數最多 30 人為主，最低開班人數 10 人。

events.name: ETH 2.0 Phase 0: Towards Beacon Chain Mainnet with Prysmatic Labs
events.description:
Agenda:
6:00pm: Networking and Drinks
6:30pm: Towards Beacon Chain Mainnet

-----------------------------------------------------

Presentation: Towards Beacon Chain Mainnet with Terence Tsao

Ethereum 2.0 has been worked on for years, and has undergone innumerable iterations. It's a massive re-architecture of the Ethereum platform, involving new components such as proof of stake-based consensus, sharding, a WebAssembly-based VM, and more. These changes, if successful, will provide significant boosts to Ethereum's security, scalability, and decentralization. Prysmatic Labs is one of 8 teams building an ETH 2.0 client - the name of Prsymatic's client is Prysm.

Since his talk last May, Terence will give an update on the following topics:
• ETH2.0 Beacon chain spec changes
• Prysm Q4/2019 accomplishments
• Lessons learned from running Prysm single client testnet
• Current progress on a multi-client testnet
• ETH 2.0 phase 0 development
• Prysm's 2020 roadmap

*** This event is about the future of Ethereum as a whole, with one of its leading client engineering teams. Don't miss it! ***

-----------------------------------------------------

About the Meetup
The SF Ethereum Developers Meetup has hosted Ethereum and blockchain-related events since early 2016. We are committed to spreading knowledge about distributed ledger technology, especially as it pertains to smart contracts and public, decentralized Turing-complete computing platforms.

About the Venue Host
Starfish Mission is a hub for emerging tech communities with a focus on blockchain/Web3, based out of the mid-market area in San Francisco. As an organization, and network, Starfish is committed to creating spaces and learning networks for a community of builders, and doers. Offerings at Starfish include coworking and office space, curated industry events, and education. Reach out to them at [masked] or visit www.starfish.network.

-----------------------------------------------------

events.name: Ethereum 2.0 – guide to start staking AND 3Box – portable user data for dapps
events.description:
Ethereum 2.0 - Chi-Hao Poon and Carl Gärdsell:
Ethereum is a global, open-source platform for decentralized applications built with Blockchain technology.

Ethereum’s Serenity upgrade will bring Sharding, Proof of Stake, a new virtual machine (eWASM) and more. It’s important to understand that this upgrade will not take place at a single point in time – instead, it will be rolled out in phases. We are going to talk about blockchain, what Phase 0 means, and how to become a validator.

3Box - Joel Torstensson:
Blockchains sparked an evolution in p2p technologies, but what does Web3 bring us beyond cryptocurrencies? 3Box is a tool that enables user-centric portable data that is compatible with dApps building on any blockchain, be it Ethereum, Cosmos, Polkadot, etc. This is enabled by combining the decentralized identity (DID) standard with sophisticated use of IPFS. Building user friendly dApps has been a challenge, but that is rapidly changing. #BuildBetter

events.name: It's a Merry Merkle!
events.description:
Magic internet money is about more than getting rich online.

It's about changing the definition of wealth so that it has more to do with who can access it, how much we can all share, and how we choose to participate with the communities in which we find ourselves.

Given the recent protest action in Cape Town, we've decided to help vulnerable women and mothers through an awesome initiative called The Zoe Project.

Come and help #MerryMerkle - our annual Ethereum giving tradition - as we paint murals, install air-conditioners and complete other maintenance tasks at brick-and-mortar clinics in Cape Town. Get your hands dirty, and help raise magic money for something truly worthwhile.

You'll also get to be a part of a truly global campaign! Part of the money we raise globally will go to educating people in Brazilian favelas, as well as to Unicef's new Crypto Fund in our attempt make this a truly planetary tradition. Don't miss out on your opportunity to be a part of something bigger than just the next software release or twitter thread.

More details here:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/MerkleMerry
Merry Merkel: https://merrymerkle.christmas/ (Without metamask)
Merry Merkel: https://merrymerkle.eth/ (With metamask)

About the Zoe Project: https://thezoeproject.co.za/

--------------------

Time:

--------------------

Where:

Enterprise Works

--------------------

Discussion Topics:

1) Examining Applications of the Ecosystem

After several years of the cryptocurrency and practical byzantine fault-tolerant network (i.e., blockchain) space's growth, we are finally beginning to see interesting applications for users of the networks. Thus, I believe there must be awareness and education on what is currently being built out there.
Focus will begin broad by examining and analyzing the overall ecosystem. Thus, the following topics will be covered:

1) Decentralized Finance (DeFi):
MakerDAO (https://makerdao.com/)
Ethereum (https://ethereum.org/)

a) Derivatives
- Redeemable Dai (rDai) (https://redeem.money/)
- Dai
- USD Coin
- TrueUSD
- Wrapped Bitcoin (https://www.wbtc.network/)
- Synthetix (https://www.synthetix.io/ - Lite Paper → https://www.synthetix.io/uploads/synthetix_litepaper.pdf
- AnchorUSD (https://www.anchorusd.com/)
- Bancor Network (https://www.bancor.network/)

b) Wallets
- Coinbase Wallet (https://wallet.coinbase.com/)
- MetaMask (https://metamask.io/)
- DeFi Saver
- InstaDApp (https://instadapp.io/)

c) Insurance
- Nexus Mutual (https://www.nexusmutual.io/)
- Etherisc (https://etherisc.com/ - White Paper → https://etherisc.com/files/etherisc_whitepaper_1.01_en.pdf)
- VouchForMe

d) Lending
- Compound Finance (https://compound.finance/ - White Paper → https://compound.finance/documents/Compound.Whitepaper.pdf)
- BlockFI (https://blockfi.com/)
- CDPs
- Fulcrum
- Nexo (https://nexo.io/)

e) Swaps
- UniSwap
- Shiftly (https://shiftly.finance/)
- AirSwap (https://www.airswap.io/)

f) Analytics
- MKR Tools (https://mkr.tools/)
- My DeFi (https://mydefi.org/apps)
- Chainbeat.io (https://chainbeat.io/(https://chainbeat.io/)
- The Stablecoin Index (https://stablecoinindex.com/)
- Loan Scan (https://loanscan.io/)
- Dai Embassy (https://www.daiembassy.online/)

f) Exchanges and Marketplaces
a) P2P
- LocalBitcoins
- LocalCryptos (https://localcryptos.com/)
- OpenBazaar (https://openbazaar.org/)
- CryptoKitties
- GitCoin (https://gitcoin.co/)
- Bounties Network (https://bounties.network/)

b) Others (margin, derivatives)
- Binance
- District0x (https://district0x.io/)
- IDEX (https://auroradao.com/platform/idex/)
- Oasis App
- dydx (https://trade.dydx.exchange/)
- Synthetix Exchange (https://synthetix.exchange/)

2) Why the Unversity (and any university) should run Ethereum nodes

1) Infrastructure and Development:

- MainframeOS (https://mainframe.com/ - White Paper → https://mainframe.docsend.com/view/j39qpui)
- Whisp (https://whisp.money/)

- Celer Network (https://www.celer.network/)
- GroundHog

- uport.me

- Blocknative
- Alchemy
- Fabrx
- Fortmatic

- OmiseGO
- StablePay (https://stablepay.io/)
- Lightning Network (https://lightning.network/)
- Bolt Labs (https://boltlabs.tech/)

2) Benefits of Having a Node?

- https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/4108/what-are-the-valuable-benefits-of-having-a-node
- https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Full_node and https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Clearing_Up_Misconceptions_About_Full_Nodes
- https://ethresear.ch/t/incentives-for-running-full-ethereum-nodes/1239

3) Ease of Access (Cognitive Ease)

- QuikNode → https://quiknode.io/
- BlockDaemon → https://blockdaemon.com/

b) Plug and Play Nodes and Miners
- Suite of Avado Devices (https://ava.do/)
- Coinmine https://coinmine.com/

User Apps:
- Cent
- Augur
- Brave Browser
- OpenLaw (OpenLaw Finance)
- Pepo (https://pepo.com/)
- Kickback
--------------------

NOTE:

The beginning of this presentation will be a cram course for the first 30 minutes for so, introducing everyone to the myriad of applications listed. Later I will focus on analyzing the value of these applications, and an intuition for the community is heading. Finally, I will present my case on serious University involvement and why every university should run several Ethereum nodes.

events.name: 🇫🇷 DF #3 - Smart Wallets, Actifs Synthétiques & Finance Décentralisée
events.description:
Finissions l'année en beauté avec la troisième édition de DeFi France où l'on continuera d'explorer les arcanes de ce qu'Ethereum permet d'envisager pour la finance du futur.
On commencera par considérer les actifs synthétiques avant d'explorer les possibilités offertes par un smart wallet pour la banque du futur.

I/ Présentation : Pascal Tallarida (Jarvis) — Synthetix - Actifs synthétiques, trader et investir sur les actions, l'immobilier et le Bitcoin sur Ethereum

Pascal présentera les différentes possibilités déjà existantes qui font le lien entre la finance décentralisée et le monde réel : biens immobiliers, actions, voir même monnaies, représentées sur Ethereum. Il y expliquera les deux écoles qui rendent cette interopérabilité possible, la tokenisation et la synthétisation.

II/ Présenta­tion Julien Niset (Argent) — Smart Wallets + DeFi: la Banque du Futur?

Pour que la DeFi se développe, elle doit être accessible. Julien présentera les possibilités qu'offrent les smart wallets pour sécuriser leur cryptos. Ils offrent une meilleure sécurité mais aussi expérience utilisateur améliorée grâce à des intégrations avec Maker ou Compound.

III/ Thibaut Sahaghian (Multis) — Crypto et “composabilité”: comment Multis réinvente la banque ?

Multis est un compte bancaire en ligne conçu pour les entreprises détenant des actifs numériques en plus de leurs fonds en euros ou dollars. Nous leur permettons de les stocker, les échanger, et recevoir des intérêts sur ceux-ci.

Thibaut introduira le concept de composabilité et expliquera comment Multis l’applique en assemblant des briques logicielles traditionnelles et crypto pour proposer une nouvelle expérience bancaire aux entreprises.

IV/ Pizzas, bières & networking

Retrouvez les slides, la vidéo et les photos de la première édition ici : https://monolith.app.link/BFPsUd3ab1

---

OÙ ?
PALO IT
162 Rue de Rivoli, 75001 Paris, France

QUAND ?
Jeudi 12 Décembre à 19h
--- À PROPOS ---

- Monolith.xyz -
Monolith développe une alternative décentralisée à un service bancaire classique. Grâce à des choix techniques innovants (contract wallet), Monolith est en mesure d'offrir une sécurité supérieure aux wallets classiques, tout en permettant à ses utilisateurs de dépenser leurs ETH et autres tokens construits sur Ethereum (ERC-20) n'importe où avec une carte de crédit Visa.

- PALO IT -
PALO IT est un cabinet de conseil international spécialisé en Design centré sur l’Humain, en développement logiciel Agile et dans la Transformation des entreprises tournées vers le futur.
Nous accompagnons nos clients à lancer rapidement des produits et services, à créer de nouveaux modèles d'affaires et à préparer le leadership et la culture de l'entreprise pour faire face aux défis de demain.

- PARASWAP -
Paraswap est un service qui agrège la liquidité de différents échanges décentralisés (Uniswap, Bancor, Kyber, etc.) afin de faciliter les échanges. Les ordres des utilisateurs de Paraswap peuvent être exécutés sur plusieurs échanges différents pour garantir un meilleur taux.

events.name: 100x your game on Ethereum + SKALE

venue.name: Starfish Mission - Emerging Tech Coworking Space

group.name: Starfish Mission - San Francisco Blockchain Events

events.description:
It's the holiday season, which is, of course, the best time to get some extra wisdom on the best approaches to building highly performant decentralized games on Ethereum. In this workshop, you will learn how to deploy Ethereum game to SKALE using your favorite developer tools (Truffle, Web3.js, ...) and run it with zero delays and subsecond block times in a completely gas-free environment.

In this workshop, Christine Perry, SKALE VP of Solutions Engineering, will explain SKALE technology and show how to build gaming dApps on Ethereum + SKALE.

Agenda:
6.00 - 6.30 PM - Check-In, tacos, beers, networking
6.30 - 7.10 PM - SKALE Game Deployment workshop
7.10 - 7.30 PM - Q&A
7.30 - 8.00 PM - More tacos and networking

Speaker:

Christine Perry
VP Solutions Engineering, SKALE Labs
Christine manages the customer success journey both pre and post-sales. This includes developing custom integrations, prototypes, delivering technical workshops and working with dApp developers and leading ecosystem growth projects.

SKALE Network:

The SKALE Network is an elastic, modular network of blockchains built with cutting edge threshold cryptography and containerization technology. The result is an easy-to-use, secure, fast, cost-effective decentralized cloud. With SKALE, dApps can deploy their own blockchain and configure it to their unique requirements.
SKALE is supported by top blockchain VCs including Multicoin Capital, Hashed, Blockchange, Galaxy Digital, Neo Global Capital, Floodgate, and others.
The SKALE Network is supported by top validators in the world including Blockware, ConsenSys, Certus.One, Chorus One, Dokia, Figment Networks, Hashed, Staked, StakewithUs, and Stake X, as well as key infrastructure player Bison Trails.

To learn more about SKALE, check out the developer’s portal and Github here:
https://skale.network/
https://github.com/skalenetwork
Twitter: @SkaleNetwork
Discord: http://skale.chat

events.name: Blockchain User Experience
events.description:
More info at:
http://seattleblockchaintraining.com/BlockchainUserExperience/

Every 1st and 3rd Wednesday night at Code Fellows in Seattle, Denny Way. The main hour is from 7-8pm, but you are invited to join 30 mins before and stay 30 mins after.

This meetup is free. Bring a phone or laptop for apps. Bringing change up to $5 for trading with others is optional.

Practice using the blockchain first hand with others. We'll start and end by receiving and sending real blockchain currency with each other(values from less than a penny up to $1). No experience is required and I can send you free change to get you started. We'll learn to use everything from Bitcoin and Ethereum to 20 other brands like Litecoin, XRP, BNB, EOS, and Monero.

Other topics include:
-Finding and installing the latest apps for phone or laptop
-Finding popular DApps and playing them (websites where you can earn or spend crypto)
-Trying new features like lightning network, making our own smart contracts, or creating new DAI stablecoin
-Security with hardware and paper wallets, non-custodial vs. custodial
-Using exchanges like Coinbase and Binance and market vs. limit orders
-Understanding market cap, supply, portfolio balancing, and cold storage
-Saving, spending, and donating cryptocurrency

We'll focus on blockchains and apps we can use today, not future marketing.

Ray has been using blockchain 6yrs and teaching blockchain 2yrs. He owns 75 of the top 100 coins and uses native blockchain software from each. During his year with Blockchain Training Alliance, Ray flew to national banks of Thailand, Philippines, and Sri Lanka as a solo instructor teaching up to 30 students per class. He's also taught in DC, New York, and Seattle.

Ray has 25 years experience in database development with 8 years at Microsoft and 3 at Amazon. He's currently a contract big data consultant in the Seattle Area. https://www.linkedin.com/in/raymetz100/

Code Fellows is across the street from the Pacific Science Center.

Parking info from Code Fellows: There is on-site parking, street parking, and ample public transportation options. We use apps such as Parkopedia, for garage options, and One Bus Away for bus route planning, hope that is helpful to you!
Bike parking is available on level 'UP' in the parking garage below the building. Garage access via the northwest corner of 2nd and Broad. Please supply your own lock.

group.name: PegNet - A Stablecoin Network for DeFi - NYC Chapter

events.description:
PegNet is a novel innovation and contribution to decentralized finance (DeFi) and cryptocurrency in that it is a fully-auditable, open-source, decentralized, autonomous, trustless and CPU-minable network of stablecoins built on top of Ethereum and the Factom Protocol with cheap transactions, and no collateral or reserve-based issues to contend with as it functions by proof of work mining and submitting Oracle Price Records onto the blockchain. PegNet also functions as a layer-two, scalable blockchain solution with cross-chain interoperability. Keeping in line with Satoshi's vision, PegNet is a simply fair-start mineable cryptocurrency since the genesis block, with no founder's reward, no ICO or IEO, and no Airdrops.

7:00-8:00 Guest Speakers/Defi/What is PegNet?

events.name: Web3 Weekly Hack / Flex Dapps Office Hours
events.description:
Are you interested in Web3 technologies like blockchains, smart contracts and other decentralised systems? Do you want to meet other curious people or even learn to build on Web3 tech?

Well you’ve found the perfect entry point! This event is run by Flex Dapps, a web3 venture studio who build all sorts of esoteric web3 powered stuff. (https://flexdapps.com) At the Weekly Hack you can pick the brains of our team and the Web3 Melbourne community and ask all your questions about web3 tech, blockchains and cryptocurrency.

The Web3 Hack is an informal gathering of Melbourne’s Web3 devs, hobbyists and learners. There’s no real agenda unless otherwise stated, it's a self directed evening of discussion, coding and fun. We like to sound out our ideas, interrogate problems and build funky stuff.

Hosted by Tom Nash and Alexander Ramsey. Tom is a software engineer who has been working with Smart Contracts and Ethereum since November 2016 and Alex has a background in startups and building odd things.

At the Web3 Hack you can do things like:
- Find high quality information and start your journey into Web3
- Find people who can introduce you to the broader Australian community.
- Learn how to set up your environment for Smart Contract development
- Learn best practises for developing, like automated tests (they’re super fun trust me) and automatic migrations
- Receive a high level overviews of what’s possible on Ethereum and the challenges you might face in a project
- Make friends!

Supported by Flex Dapps (https://flexdapps.com/), Web3 Australia (https://web3australia.org)

Also please join the Discord group where we chat about meetups past, present and future, as well as a bunch of other things like hackathons/news/general scheming: https://discord.gg/HVS7BVE

events.name: Connected Smart Contracts: Develop a real-world connected Dapp using Honeycomb

group.name: Chainlink New York: Connected Smart Contracts

events.description:
RSVP here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/connected-smart-contracts-nyc-develop-a-real-world-connected-dapp-using-honeycomb-tickets-84270815277

Description
Decentralized oracle networks inherently suffer from a chicken-and-egg
problem regarding data sources and smart contract use-cases. We will
kickstart this event by giving an overview of Honeycomb Marketplace as a
solution, which provides a wide variety of data to build Chainlinked
dapps today. Following this, we will demonstrate how easy it is to
develop a real-world connected dapp using Honeycomb. Attendees are
highly encouraged to bring their laptops to follow along.

Agenda
6:30 PM to 6:45 PM - Food and Drinks

7:00 PM to 8:30 PM - Development Workshop

8:30 PM to 9:00 PM Final Wrap-up / Mingling

What to bring
Laptop and charger

Presenter Bio
Burak Benligiray, CTO of CLC Group

Burak bio:
Burak is CTO of CLC Group, a company founded by the members of the
Chainlink community. With his team, he is building the Honeycomb
Marketplace, which allows developers to easily connect their smart
contracts to some of the world's premier API providers.

About Honeycomb:
Honeycomb is an API marketplace purpose-built for connecting smart
contracts to high-quality external data inputs from some of the world's
premier data providers. Smart contracts can query APIs on Honeycomb via
decentralized Chainlink oracles, allowing the contract to execute in a
highly reliable, end-to-end secure manner on networks such as Ethereum,
Bitcoin and Hyperledger.

Visit Honeycomb at: https://honeycomb.market/

About Chainlink
Chainlink is a decentralized oracle network that enables smart contracts to securely access off-chain data feeds, web APIs, and traditional bank payments. Chainlink is consistently selected as one of the top blockchain technologies by leading independent research firms such as Gartner. It is well known for providing highly secure and reliable oracles to both large enterprises (SWIFT Google, Oracle) and leading smart contract development teams (Web3 Foundation, OpenLaw, Zeppelin, MARKET Protocol, and more).

events.description:
Are you interested in Web3 technologies like blockchains, smart contracts and other decentralised systems? Do you want to meet other curious people or even learn to build on Web3 tech?

Well you’ve found the perfect entry point! This event is run by Flex Dapps, a web3 venture studio who build all sorts of esoteric web3 powered stuff. (https://flexdapps.com) At the Weekly Hack you can pick the brains of our team and the Web3 Melbourne community and ask all your questions about web3 tech, blockchains and cryptocurrency.

The Web3 Hack is an informal gathering of Melbourne’s Web3 devs, hobbyists and learners. There’s no real agenda unless otherwise stated, it's a self directed evening of discussion, coding and fun. We like to sound out our ideas, interrogate problems and build funky stuff.

Hosted by Tom Nash and Alexander Ramsey. Tom is a software engineer who has been working with Smart Contracts and Ethereum since November 2016 and Alex has a background in startups and building odd things.

At the Web3 Hack you can do things like:
- Find high quality information and start your journey into Web3
- Find people who can introduce you to the broader Australian community.
- Learn how to set up your environment for Smart Contract development
- Learn best practises for developing, like automated tests (they’re super fun trust me) and automatic migrations
- Receive a high level overviews of what’s possible on Ethereum and the challenges you might face in a project
- Make friends!

Supported by Flex Dapps (https://flexdapps.com/), Web3 Australia (https://web3australia.org)

Also please join the Discord group where we chat about meetups past, present and future, as well as a bunch of other things like hackathons/news/general scheming: https://discord.gg/HVS7BVE

events.name: Self-sovereign identity blockchain libraries: Step by Step Tutorial
events.description:
##When?
12/12/[masked]

##Description
A few months ago, we (Caelum Labs), the company behind this meetup, received a Grant from the Web3 Foundation to work on an open-source Digital Identity library for Blockchain made in Rust. And so we did :)

After months of hard work, we have opened the libraries to the world. So, we plan to explain the ins and outs of this Self-Sovereign Identity framework we’ve been working on in Substrate for the web3 ecosystem.

If you want to learn more about our Tech stack and solution join us for an evening where you can learn how to use our set of libraries.

We are eager to share what we have built with you. Your feedback will be more than welcome.

So please join us if you wish to learn about:

- Digital Identity on Polkadot & Substrate
- Working with DIDs (Decentralized Identifiers) and VC (Verifiable
Credentials), the web3 standards.
- Understanding Zero Knowledge Proofs with Zenroom (A
Cryptographic Virtual Machine)

Also, we will show you our first version for the Personal Identity Container on a Raspberry Pi based on Decode OS (Devuan + TOR).

If any of the words we used don’t sound familiar, don’t worry at all, we will go step by step explaining each and every concept :)

This meetup is organized by Caelum Labs.
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/caelumlabs
Subscribe to our newsletter: http://newsletter.caelumlabs.com

##Preliminary agenda
19.00h - Welcome
19.15h - Alex Puig will share a brief tech introduction to SSI
19.30h - Libraries explanation / live coding
20.30h - Q&A and Beers, thanks to Estrella Damm :)
21.00h - End

Come and join us in the last meetup of the year! :D

Who is Alex Puig?
#########
Over the last few years, Alex specializes in the blockchain field, in particular, his expertise is in software development, data platforms, standards, identity, privacy and decentralized technology for different industries.

Alex Puig is Founder and CTO at Caelum Labs a blockchain development studio focused on identity and privacy. He is also the founder of Alastria, the world’s first national blockchain network, co-chairs Inatba’s Identity Working Group, and he co-founded Digital Currency Summit. He is an active member of the Blockchain open-source community.

A software developer by trade, Alex links the coding and corporate worlds with innovative creativity and inspirational energy. He advises governments, public administration agencies, and supranational organizations in Self-Sovereign Identity and Blockchain.

Alex sees technology as a way to improve society, and advocates for a reshaping of the internet to make it more secure and empowering.

events.name: Challenges and the future of Bitcoins's Lightning Network
events.description:
Session 1:
A Cryptoeconomic Traffic Analysis of Bitcoin's Lightning Network

Bitcoin miners are rewarded with block rewards and transaction fees to maintain the Bitcoin blockchain. Similarly, router nodes (those forwarding payments in the Lightning Network (LN)) are compensated with transaction fees. However it is not well understood whether this financial incentive is comparable to the miner's incentives. Ferenc will talk about how much currently routers gain from providing services on the Lightning Network and why little financial incentives are problematic. In this talk we will also hear about more the privacy shortcomings of LN.

About Ferenc Beres:

PhD student in Computer Science who works at the Informatics Laboratory of the Institute for Computer Science and Control (SZTAKI). His area of research is temporal network analysis.

Session 2:
Recent advancements and developments in the Lightning Network and future perspectives

Silur is going to cover the most important recent developments in the Lightning Network and their importance. Namely, he will touch upon atomic multipath payments, channel factories splicing and submarine swaps. If you're interested in these new cryptographic protocols then you should definitely attend :)

About Silur:
Silur is an expert in lattice-based and non-commutative cryptography. He made valuable contributions to the Ethereum and Monero projects.

Do not forget to schedule some time for a beer afterwards, celebrating the first year of the Open Blockchain Community!

events.name: Elanim Ecosystem with Kodiri: Coding workshop: Create a ReactJs app
events.description:
Workshop presented by Kodiri.com - All you need is CODE!

Details
*LAST EVENT OF 2019!*

Agenda:
18:00h: Arrival and seating
18:20h: Create a ReactJS app
19:05h: ReactJS training to reviewing the learnt techniques
19:20h: Networking

No former experience required! Here's a video with some very basic preparation tasks, to ensuring your laptop is ready to start working with React from the 1st minute:
https://kodiri.com/platform/videos/meetup-reactjs
(Please only look after the first video, as we'll cover the rest during the session :))

Do you know which is the most popular programming language today?

It's JavaScript! Actually, according to GitHub -the Bible of coding-, Javascript is insanely popular, even more than the next two in the list combined (Python and Java)

https://octoverse.github.com/

JavaScript, however, can't work on its own end to end. It needs, still in 2018, to be used in combination of other libraries to creating powerful apps.

In that respect, ReactJs, owned by Facebook has emerged as the most popular "UI library" due to its simplicity and modular nature.

We are going to create a webpApp using ReactJs, from scratch. Starting from the basics, we'll follow the most advanced development techniques to build a universal app for mobile, tablet and desktop.

We'll cover, in a time-box of 60 minutes, the following aspects:

1) Setting up the working environment: tooling, dependencies, etc: Attendees are expected to prepare this upfront.
2) Creating a responsive UI, adapted for multiple devices: We'll talk a bit about this, but please note this is NOT a UX session, so e.g. we aren't going to touch any CSS at all
3) Mastering ReactJS Components: industry patterns, best practices, etc: Yes, that's the main point of the session. We'll also talk a bit about the background of React: why it is so popular, who looks after it and why it 'defeated' its rivals. 4) Navigating through page views: This is beyond the scope of the session. We'd need an entire workshop just to talk about routing - more than happy to look after on a separate session next year, though :)

This session will be driven by Ricardo Mallols, who has an intensive coding experience across multiple countries and industries over 15+ years. He's also participated in multiple conferences and events, including a JavaScript talk at an international Google conference.

Just RSVP to attend it; don't miss this unique opportunity to learn, for free the most demanded technology in a friendly working environment!

Brainlabs is a digital marketing agency and PPC technology provider. Using data and automation, Brainlabs drives growth for clients in paid search, programmatic, paid social, CRO and analytics.

events.name: New Regulations. Who Dis? - The Coming Changes in Digital Currency Regulations
events.description:
Are you ready for the big changes to Canadian Digital Currency Regulations?

Canada’s anti-money laundering (AML) regulator has released updated guidance for client identification. Dealers in virtual currency will be regulated as money services businesses (MSBs) in Canada as of June 1, 2020. All virtual currency transactions of CAD 1,000 or more will require identification using these methods.

We’ve assembled a panel of experts to discuss vetted solutions, challenges in identifying Canadian clients and more.

If this affects you or your company you should attend this free deep-dive into the changes in the regulatory landscape for Digital Currencies in 2020.

events.name: How To Profit From Crypto Before The Next Big Bull Run!
events.description:
Due to the success of our last London Cryptocurrency Event, you are invited to an encore event with our special guest speaker, Corey Chadwick.

👉Register here: http://bit.ly/CryptoLondon

We will cover:

- Why now is the best time to invest for the lowest risk and biggest rewards
- How small investments, compounded can generate huge profits
- The TWO key events in 2020 that will massively impact Bitcoin’s price
- How to spot and steer clear of scams, frauds and Ponzi schemes

You’re bound to have heard about the rise, fall, and imminent resurgence of the cryptocurrency market.

It was all over the news in 2017 as the price of Bitcoin and ‘alternative’ coins like Ethereum, Ripple and Litecoin all skyrocketed.

And almost overnight, those ‘early adopters’ turned into instant millionaires.

You only have to google investors like the Winklevoss twins, now worth $1.5bn, or Richard Branson, who has invested $30m in Bitcoin startups so far, to see the potential of crypto to make *some* people very wealthy.

Thing is, you don’t need pockets full of cash to make it in the crypto world.

Most investors start small and compound their profits until they can exit with a tidy nest egg.

This encore event will show you how to do just this - position yourself for the next crypto boom, which experts believe is just around the corner.

Whether you’re already familiar with this industry or a total newbie, this event will help take your understanding about cryptocurrencies to the next level.

You will discover how our guest speaker Corey Chadwick, a former Fortune 500 financial analyst, turned a $10k investment into $15 million during the height of the last crypto boom.

But that’s not all.

Corey made a further 1,900% on his investments during the crypto winter of 2018 while the market was in freefall .

Today, besides trading cryptocurrencies, Corey runs two hedge funds, advises companies on their ICO strategy and is an in-demand crypto coach. He has made 8 figures with crypto and is passionate about educating others.

So come along to this intimate event in London to hear his story, learn what’s possible in this space and put your questions to the man himself!

You'll discover:

- The smart strategies that helped Corey turn $10k into $15 million
- How it’s possible to profit in both bear and bull markets
- Corey’s process for uncovering hidden gems that can generate 10x returns
- What is really causing the volatility in crypto - it’s not what you think!
- Practical ways to keep your investments safe
- How to ‘cash out’ your crypto and be more tax-efficient in the UK

Our goal is to equip ordinary, hard-working people with enough knowledge of the crypto world so they can make informed decisions for themselves.

After all, you work hard for your money, isn't it time it did the same for you?

This event will show you how, by making smart crypto moves, even a modest investment can explode in value by as much as 100,000% in the next few years.

So, what have you got to lose?

👉 Register here: http://bit.ly/CryptoLondon

Honestly, there are so many takeaways up for grabs at this event. Just one gold nugget could pay off handsomely...

We could easily charge £500+ for tickets.

But since our goal is to open up the crypto world to more people, we’re offering Early Bird tickets until 27 November for just £15.

The clock’s ticking... so book your tickets today!

👉Register here: http://bit.ly/CryptoLondon

On Wednesday 27 November, tickets will go up to £25. If there are any left then the door price will be £30.

Besides the education, we’ll keep you refreshed with tea, coffee, Prosecco, beer, cider and a selection of tasty nibbles (1 alcoholic drink per person).

Event Agenda:

6:00pm - 6:30pm - Registration & Networking

6:30pm - 6:45pm - Welcome & Introduction

6:45pm - 7:45pm - Keynote Speaker Corey Chadwick

7:45pm - 8:00pm - Tax Expert Paul Elliot

8:00pm - 8:30pm - Q&A & Networking

Look forward to seeing you on Wednesday 11 December at 6pm!

events.name: Gitcoin Virtual Hackathon, Bounties!!! Recompensas!!!

venue.name: Escola Politècnica Superior de la Universitat d'Alacant
venue.address_1: Carr. San Vicente del Raspeig, s/n

events.description:
¡Recientemente nos unimos a la Red Consensys #BUIDL!
Estamos asociados con Gitcoin para un hackathon VIRTUAL temático de "Comunidad" del 2 al 16 de diciembre. ¡Pasa por la Escuela Politécnica Superior en la Universidad de Alicante el 13 de diciembre para más detalles, forma un equipo y lanza una idea!
TODOS los niveles son bienvenidos :)

Este es un hackathon virtual organizado por Gitcoin. Los desarrolladores de todo el mundo se unirán para construir la infraestructura para una nueva Internet descentralizada, compitiendo para ganar premios de criptomonedas en el camino.

Este evento es para codificadores y no codificadores por igual para formar equipos, presentar ideas y formular planes para sus proyectos.

Que debes traer
Proyecos, Ideas, ganas de participar

16:30 -- Presentación del embajador #BUIDLnetwork Consensys
16:45 -- Introducción al Hackathon virtual de Gitcoin
17:00 -- Revisión de premios / Formación de equipos / Exposicion de proyectos
18:30 -- Registro del proyecto / Pasos siguientes

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We recently joined the Consensys #BUIDL Network! They have partnered with Gitcoin for a “Community” themed VIRTUAL hackathon December 2nd - 16th. Stop by EPS at University of Alacant on 12/2 for details, form a team and pitch an idea! ALL levels are welcome :)

This is a virtual hackathon hosted by Gitcoin. Developers from around the world will come together to build the infrastructure for a new, decentralized Internet, competing to earn cryptocurrency prizes along the way.

This event is for coders and noncoders alike to form teams, pitch ideas and formulate plans for their projects.

What to bring
Hackathon Project Ideas
Laptop (but not needed)

If you’re not able to make the event, you can still participate! Sign up below:
https://share.hsforms.com/1bf0FjMk-QTaby_Mf9a79LQ2urwb
events.how_to_find_us: Nos encontrarás en el Hall de la Escuela Politécnica Superior de la UA, junto al Salón de Grados

events.name: II BlockChain & Beers not Bombs
events.description:
Ante el éxito del Primer Blockchain & Beers not Bomb

Te invito a participar en el
Blockchain & Beers not Bomb II
y participa en la Re-Evolución Blockchain

Conoce este nuevo escenario económico y financiero inminente que se avecina y participa activamente con personas de tu ciudad para construir o/y usar las nuevas herramientas digitales
( como MetaMask, los Wallet, los Exchange, las Dapps ...)
utilizando las Descentralizadas Autónomas Organizacións (DAO) como Bitcoin.

La misión del Meetup es conocer nuestros intereses e intercambiar información de Bitcoin, Criptomonedas, Blockchain, DAO, Dapps, Seguridad desde diferentes enfoques trader/holder, minero, desarrollador/hacker, emprendedor, usuario, inversor.

Y sobre todo pasar un rato agradable

• What we'll do
Hablaremos de la tecnología, de inversiones, de exchange, wallets, cómo comprar y vender, nuevas monedas, tokens, etc.
Hablaremos sobre la usabilidad de la tecnología Blockchain y las aplicaciones fuera del ambito de las finanzas.
Hablaremos de Tokenización, Cryptoeconomía, Tokeneconomía.

• What to bring
Vuestros conocimientos y ganas de una charla avanzada y una cerveza bien fría :)

• Important to know
No tiene ningún coste de asistencia y tampoco se ofrece bebida ni comida gratis.

Bienvenidos
Hackers, CrYptoFrikYs Y Curios@s
Nos vemos pronto
events.how_to_find_us: Puedes preguntar a los camareros del O'hara de Luceros cual es la mesa Crypto, Blockchain, Bitcoin

events.name: Indianapolis Blockchain Meetup
events.description:
Tomorrow we will have our event at the blind owl.
Topics of interest will be Hyperledger, Ethereum smart contracts and getting started writing them.
This group is intended to help educate the community and attendees on Blockchain Technology. We encourage projects and community workgroups. Each month we will look at topics facing the industry as a whole. What solutions have been proposed and are currently in use world wide.
Focus will be on the technology of Blockchain and not trading of Crypto Currencies or exchanges. However we can help answer those types of questions.
This is an interactive round table discussion type meetup. We will have classroom type deliveries from time to time.

events.name: Blockchain Training NYC: Beginner Level

group.name: Blockchain Crypto Bootcamp Training for Professionals

events.description:
You will get 3 hours of onsite training + 3 Hours of online Zoom session training + 3 hours of tech support.

RSVP HERE: https://ebsexecutivetraining.com/collections/nyc-ebs-executive-training-level-1-novice/products/ebs-blockchain-technology-executive-training-level-1-novice

Learn to analyze, trade, and build your own Blockchain tokens

Who this course is for:
- Entrepreneurs, developers, beginners, non-programmers, anyone interested in learning the fundamentals of blockchain technology

This workshop provides step-by-step instructions on how to analyze, trade, and build individual blockchain tokens.

NO PROGRAMMING EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

This workshop consists of 70% gathering and researching Crypto data, the rest 30% is programming for those who want to build their own Blockchain solutions.

This training program enables individuals to build their crypto investments. Individuals will be able to create their Ethereum token and trading strategies.

The program uses simple games and real-time analogies to demonstrates constructs of blockchain and defines why it cannot be altered as time passes. This training enables individuals to build tools to automate the process of gathering and analyzing Crypto contracts and historical data.

Our program uses real-time testing networks to test individual crypto trading strategies. Trainees can build their individual crypto data analytics and investment solutions using python and solidity. At the end, our instructors will help you create your own blockchain program.

You will learn:
• Blockchain technology and terminology
• Types of Cryptocurrencies/tokens
• Tools to gather and analyze date
• Create trading strategies based on buy/sell signals
• Ethereum and Solidity
• How to launch your own contracts and Crypto tokens
• Build a working Blockchain project

End goals of the course:
• Your token/coin floated on Ethereum Blockchain that you can transfer to anyone
• Your trading strategy implemented and the profit loss
• Your Python blockchain on Azure Notebook

events.name: Blockchain Drenthe Meetup @ Emmen.IT
events.description:
Agenda for this meetup:
- Latest news in blockchainland (Adri Wischmann)
- Brand Loyalty and Blockchain
What are Non Fungible Tokens? How do they work? Can they be used on the blockchain to improve brand loyalty? (Danny Dreves)
- Hands-on session with CryptoZombies
Talking about smart contracts: how do you make or program them? CryptoZombies (google it) is a fun way to learn so. You will do the basic steps in writing Solidity a smart contract. It's a hands-on session (take youre laptop with you) -no need to be an expert-

there will be pizza and... at the end because its our last meetup of the year some nice drinks and talks.

[if all attendants are fluid in Dutch then the speakers will use Dutch in their presentations. If there are people present who cannot understand Dutch the speakers will switch to English]

Blockchain en Cryptocurrencies staan het laatste jaar flink in de belangstelling, je kunt de krant niet openslaan of er wordt wel iets over geschreven en ook het journaal brengt regelmatig nieuws hierover onder de aandacht. Vrijwel iedereen heeft al eens de term Bitcoin horen vallen maar over "de Blockchain" is niet zo heel veel bekend.

Deze meetup heeft tot doel iedereen met interesse in Blockchain, ICO's en Crypto met elkaar in contact te brengen. Informatie uitwisselen, leuke sprekers aanhoren, je kennis op dit gebied naar een hoger niveau trekken.
Eens in de maand komen we bij elkaar in Emmen bij Emmen.it en delen informatie met elkaar.
We starten in principe met wat informatie over de Crypto-munten-markten en verdiepen ons vervolgens in een Blockchain-related-onderwerp.

Deze Blockchain-meetup is een spin-off van BlockchainLab Drenthe (een organisatie die zich inzet voor het verspreiden van kennis op het gebied van Blockchain-techniek in Drenthe). Er zullen tijdens deze bijeenkomst deelnemers in BlockchainLab Drenthe aanwezig zijn voor mensen/bedrijven met wat meer technische vragen.
events.how_to_find_us: Kijk op http://www.emmen.it/

events.name: How Blockchain and Digital Assets are evolving

venue.name: CMS Cameron McKenna Nabarro Olswang LLP

group.name: Blockchain and Digital Assets London Meetup

events.description:
Agenda and details of speakers for Teamblockchain's October meeting:

17.30 Registration.
18.00 Welcome - Jonny Fry CEO TeamBlockchain Ltd will give an update on some the recent changes in the Blockchain and Digital-asset sectors.
18.05 Chris Luck is a Corporate Partner in the CMS Funds and Indirect Real Assets team. His main focus is in the real assets and financial sectors for UK and International clients. He advises fund managers, investors, including for investment in technology, and also advises on REITs, stock market matters and M&A activity.
Chris works with and participates in industry bodies on matters such as the Alternative Investment Fund Managers' Directive (AIFMD). He is leading the CMS Funds Group initiatives on the impact of AI & Technology in the Funds sector including tokenisation and its potential.

Jason Goldberg, is a product designer with more than 20 years of experience designing consumer internet products, who has previously founded Hem.com, Fab.com, and Social Median.
Jason is CEO of OST.com. and founder of Pepo the first crypto-powered app approved by Apple in the App Store, built on OST technology, the world's first seamlessly embeddable Ethereum wallet SDK.He will be talking about:
'Designing Crypto User Experiences for Humans'

Other speakers to be confirmed

19.10 Q&A session chaired by Sally Eaves
19.30 to 20.45 Drinks and Networking

events.name: Intro to Programming Bitcoin
events.description:
Join us for Bitcoin Programming using Python, we will learn how to:
- Parse, validate, and create bitcoin transactions
- Learn Script, the smart contract language behind Bitcoin
- Understand how proof-of-work secures the blockchain
- Program Bitcoin using Python 3
- Understand how simplified payment verification and light wallets work
- Work with public-key cryptography and cryptographic primitives

events.name: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Cryptocurrencies & The Blockchain
events.description:
Sunshine Coast Blockchain Meetup

When: 2nd Tuesday of each month
Time: Doors Open: 6.15pm for a 6.30pm Start
Where: Innovation Centre, 90 Sippy Downs Drive, Sippy Downs

What to expect:
• Formalities by Indunil Weerasinghe / Lodi Pameijer
• dHealthNetwork and USAT update by Ivan Jasenovic
• Snacks and networking
• Special Guest Speakers every month

Contact us via Facebook if you have an interesting topic you would like to present.

What to Bring:
A 'Gold Coin'
We appreciate your help & contribution to our community events by popping a 'gold coin' in the purple bottle on the food tables. Enjoy a light snack, tea or coffee provided on the evening! We encourage everyone to network and share your crypto knowledge.

This forum brings people and ideas together in an informal, friendly but dynamic manner for open and informative interactions.

The venue is provided free of charge by the Innovation Centre at the University of the Sunshine Coast.

For enquiries, please message us directly through this meet-up group or join us on the Sunshine Coast Blockchain Facebook group and Sunshine Coast Blockchain You Tube Channel.

Sunshine Coast Blockchain Team :)

events.name: Building The New Web - Latin America edition (prior to LaBitconf Dec 12-13)

group.name: The Innovation Department - Pushing a decentralised vision

events.description:
Building The New Web - Latin America edition. (right before the awesome LaBitconf happening dec 12-13)

Proudly co-sponsored by Fortmatic (https://fortmatic.com)

A technical exploration of a decentralised world.

Previous editions included showcases from projects like Mainframe, NuCypher, Solana, The Graph, Chromapolis, Quarkchain, Tomochain, Dfinity, Hedera Hashgraph, Dusk Network, Avalanche Labs, Matic Network, Infura, Harmony, Casper Labs & more.

Narrative:

The web as we know it has proven to be reminiscent of Pandora's Box. An unprecedented experiment of human faith with outcomes we had yet to discover. The discussions on privacy, security, trust, personal data and governance are becoming fiercer by the day. The loudest critics believe the foundations of the internet were flawed to begin with.

But things are changing.

Cryptographers, protocol designers and distributed systems engineers have been doing R&D for decades on how computer science could liberate our world, the web and financial systems. With the inception of Bitcoin and Ethereum a larger part of the world is witnessing the first steps into a decentralised world.

What are the next steps? Which teams are working on the cutting edge of blockchain and distributed ledger technology and are solving unprecedented challenges in the field of cryptography, consensus mechanisms, protocol design, scalability, security and on-chain governance?

During this event we will witness technical showcases from CTO's or technical leads from several different projects. After each showcase there is room for a Q&A. There will be enough time for socializing and one on ones with the projects. And yes, there is plenty of food available.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Program:

1200 - 1300 Walk in & registration

1300 - 1330 Showcase #1

1330 - 1400 Showcase #2

1400 - 1430 Showcase #3

1430 - 1500 BREAK & FOOD/DRINKS

1500 - 1530 Showcase #4:

1530 - 1600 Showcase #5:

1600 - 1630 Showcase #6:

1630 - 1700 Shwocase #7

1700 - 1800 SOCIALIZING & FOOD/DRINKS

The technical threshold to enjoy this event will be high. We encourage IT & blockchain developers, distributed systems engineers, cryptographers, security experts, protocol designers, peer to peer developers and tech savvy enthusiasts to join this event.

Until December 11th in Montevideo,

The Innovation Department

For an impression of the atmosphere and lineup of previous 'Building the new web' events:

https://twitter.com/faridrached/status/1061937644341551104?s=21

events.name: Bitcoin Wednesday Amsterdam
events.description:
Bitcoin Wednesday Amsterdam

The lineup will be announced as soon as possible. Or check here for the full program as soon as it is available.

There will be a limited number of early bird tickets available for those who RSVP early.

---

Walk-in from 1800 on, including drinks and networking. We start at 1900.

Tickets: Entrance and seating is first come, first served.

---

Bitcoin Wednesday

One of the best and longest-running regular Bitcoin and Blockchain conferences in the Netherlands.

Always held on the first Wednesday of every month.

An open and informal program for anyone interested in digital currency and the blockchain.

For Bitcoin novices and experts alike. Beginners, investors, entrepreneurs, developers, miners, traders, legal professionals -- all find value in this event.

Brings together a diverse group of people from all levels and backgrounds without any barriers in order to give this important new technology a prominent role in Dutch society.

One of the goals of Bitcoin Wednesday is to promote the industry, to spread the word about Bitcoin (and related technology) in the Netherlands by raising the overall level of awareness and knowledge.

venue.name: CryptoPlaza
venue.address_1: Calle de Don Ramón de la Cruz, 38

events.description:
Obligaciones de AML en tu negocio: entiende los porqués y entenderás tus obligaciones.

¿Qué es el blanqueo de capitales? ¿Por qué tengo que hacer AML en mi negocio? ¿Qué me obliga a hacer la ley?
En este meet up hablaremos del concepto de blanqueo de capitales para entender qué es realmente blanqueo, qué tiene que ver con tu empresa y qué espera la ley de ti.
Es una charla didáctica enfocada a entender el porqué de las obligaciones (más que en explicar las obligaciones en sí). Anímate y ven porque entendiendo los porqués te será mucho más fácil cumplir con tus obligaciones.

Este Meetup va dirigido a todas las personas afectas por la prevención de blanqueo de capitales (aunque haremos alguna mención especial a neobancos y exchanges y custodios de criptomonedas).

events.name: Rich Foster on Utility Settlement Coin
events.description:
Utility Settlement Coin – How Wholesale Banking Will Connect to Central Banking On The Chain!

The USC will be an institutional digital currency. Initially there will be digital versions of five currencies Canadian Dollars, Euros, Pounds, Japanese Yen and US Dollars. The USC is for use by financial institutions (only) to make instant settlements. The USC states it will enable a single pool of funds available for settlement across multiple markets. As opposed to pockets of money tied up separately. That pooled liquidity could also potentially be a huge cost saving, subject to regulators potentially requiring separation.

Current members are Barclays, BNY Mellon, CIBC, Commerzbank, Credit Suisse, ING, KBC Group, Lloyds, MUFG, Nasdaq, Santander, SMBC, State Street and UBS.

Presenting on this topic is former VP at Citi, Rich Foster, who will be giving his expert opinion on what this means for how blockchain is changing the future of banking.

*Disclaimer: All topics discussed are for educational and informational purposes only. Nothing discussed should be construed as investment advice. We are not financial advisors. Please consult your financial advisor before making any investments. Cryptocurrencies are very volatile. Never invest more than you’re willing to lose.*

AGENDA:
7:00p – 7:30p: Welcome & Introductions
7:30p – 8:30p: Presentation on USC
8:30p – 9:00p: Q&A

KNOWLEDGE LEVEL:
Novice to Intermediate

Tampa Bay Wave
500 E Kennedy Blvd #300
Tampa, FL 33602
Parking is free AFTER 6P along the streets North of E Kennedy Blvd.

歡迎有興趣參加的夥伴，一起來輕鬆交流、互相學習成長、認識新朋友、發現新機會！

主辦單位：BDE 區塊鏈學院，讓每個企業都懂區塊鏈。

(特別感謝)

▶️19:30~21:00 Android App Security Workshop
▶️21:00~22:00 互動交流時間

✏️注意事項
1.上機實作，請自備筆電
2.響應環保，自備水壺、水杯

---
OWASP Mobile Top 10：
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Mobile_Top_10_2016-Top_10

藉著親自並協助他人進行軟體開發，

我們正致力於發掘更優良的軟體開發方法。

events.name: C Programming Language for Software Engineers- 30 Hr Class in Vienna VA
events.description:
This hands on C programming course provides a comprehensive introduction to the ANSI C language, emphasizing portability and structured design. Students are introduced to all major language elements including fundamental data types, flow control, and standard function libraries. Thorough treatment is given to the topics of string and character manipulation, dynamic memory allocation, standard I/O, macro definition, and the C runtime library. The course explains the use of aggregate structures, unions, and pointers early on so the students can practice extensively in the hands-on labs. Structured programming constructs and varargs functions are also covered. Emphasis is given to the processing of command line arguments and environment variables so students will be able to write flexible, user-friendly programs.

No programming skills required.

This is a 5 Sat crash course.

Course Info

Length: total 30 hours
Registration Fee: $1,200 online and $1,900 in VA

Class location: 2800 Juniper St Fairfax, VA (just 3 blocks from Dunn Loring-Merrifield metro station on Orange Line)

Free parking is available too.

Refund Policy

- We fully refund you if we cancel the event.

Minimum 1 paid student is required to run this class.

For details and registration, visit the below link:
https://myhsts.org/course-introduction-to-C-programming-for-beginners.php

events.name: Best practices for securing and scaling up Node JS applications- Free workshop
events.description:
Survey of best practices for Securing and Scaling up Node.JS

It is very important to scale and secure your applications. Scaling and securing are not one-time tasks. You need to keep making changes to your code as you add new features to increase application security, and as your application traffic and data increases, you need to scale your servers.

In this workshop, you will learn how to make Node.js applications more secure and how to scale Node.js applications.

We will be assuming that you are using Express for creating your web server as it is the most common.

In this workshop, we will cover:

- Application vulnerabilities
- Non-vulnerability attacks
- Various third-party services to protect your application
- Checking security issues in third-party packages
- Techniques of distributing traffic

This workshop is a must for all MEAN stack or fullstack web developers.

Below is the link to workshop tutorial:
https://blockchain.dcwebmakers.com/blog/best-practices-for-securing-and-scaling-nodejs-applications.html

Workshop location:
12310 Pinecrest Road, Suite #306, Reston, VA 20191

events.name: Fictions and Realities of Blockchain - Zach Danker-Feldman, Xooa
events.description:
Zach Danker-Feldman is a Yale University Economics graduate that joined Xooa to evangelize enterprise blockchain adoption. He is an active member and contributor to the blockchain community, including composing and moderating a blockchain panel at Denver Startup Week, traveling the US to present on enterprise blockchain, co-organizing a Blockchain for Sustainable Development Meetup, and running a blockchain blog.

Blockchain technology is a revolutionary coordination mechanism that highlights and can solve key challenges for the continued digital transformation of our society. For a period, it was also an overhyped and poorly defined technology with few reputable projects progressing past proof of concept. We may finally be progressing beyond the hype curve, but there are still many issues that must be addressed. Complexity is among the biggest as it is a massive bottleneck for enterprise blockchain adoption.

Come join us as Zach Danker-Feldman from Xooa discusses the need for a more mature and realistic vision for the blockchain’s prospects, and how services like Xooa’s enterprise blockchain application platform remove barriers to entry and move us toward a realization of success for this technology.

Xooa, is a Hyperledger Member, and offers Ethereum with Corda and Sawtooth in the development pipeline, and their primary offering is Fabric.

events.name: Bitcoin Hack Day
events.description:
The Bitcoin Hack Day is an opportunity to break out of your normal routine and get to working on that project you have been wanting to. This is a casual event where there are no rules other than to show up with your laptop and a plan to get productive.

All types are welcome and your project doesn't have to be anything technical or complex. Come and be in the presence of other people with enthusiasm for the same technology and be part of a supportive, constructive community of builders. See what other people are doing and learn and show off your project and share what you are learning to others. Ask questions and answer questions. Give help and get help.

There will be people around that have a variety of experience in general computer stuff, Bitcoin node software, Lightning Network, Raspberry Pis, Electronics, Web Development, 3D Printing, Game Development, Python/Javascript/C/C++/C#/Java/etc., Cryptography, Private Key management, Git/GitHub/GitLab, Linux, e-commerce, Open Source, etc. The community would be happy to lend some knowledge for getting past hurdles.

Arriving and leaving at any time during the hours is perfectly fine. Bring a lunch, or plan to participate in a lunch outing on Whyte Ave.

The Bitcoin Hack Day is hosted by the Edmonton Bitcoin Association (https://edmontonbitcoin.org) which also hosts the Bitcoin Beginners Meetup on the second Tuesday of every month and the Edmonton Bitcoin Meetup on the third Wednesday of every month. We are a community of Bitcoin enthusiasts that want to help each other out and see a vibrant scene and industry grow and thrive here in Edmonton.

Another Bitcoin Hack Day is planned for April 20rd, 9am-5pm and we intend on continuing this as a regular event through 2019.

events.name: Securing Your Financial Future: Money, Crypto & You
events.description:
*******************This is a ticketed event. Please purchase your tickets by going here - http://bit.ly/W1BMClass1**************************

The data is clear, nine out of ten adults in the UK have insufficient wealth to access financial advice.

If you have less than £150,000 in savings and investments, you are one of the underserved. This number affects women even more! 24% of women living and working in modern society, compared with 18% of men, will retire in poverty.

This occurs for several reasons:

- Not enough savings

- Bad investments due to a lack of financial knowledge and education, and overall confidence

- Work breaks throughout one’s career

- Having dependents such as parents and children

- Bad relationship breakups

- Lack of understanding of investment products on offer

- Debt

With the advent and rise of fintech solutions, such as money apps, cards and accounts in the personal finance marketplace, it has made dealing with one’s finances easier but not necessarily simpler.

Add in the arrival of Blockchain technology, Bitcoin and other cryptoassets such as Ethereum, it makes for a myriad of choices to choose from. So where do you start in creating financial wellbeing and security in your life? What do you do? How do you ensure you don’t lose out on the opportunities all these new and old options provide?

Join Women in Blockchain Talks and a host of industry expert speakers across fintech, financial advisory and legal as they discuss investing in an era of digital tech and money. How do you ensure the protection of it? How do you pass on your crypto investment(s) to your next of kin? Or even still, how would your next of kin access this investment on your behalf, if you were unable to do it for yourself?

By attending this event, you will gain an understanding of:

- The fundamentals required to create financial security in your life

- Ways to protect your crypto assets, irrelevant of how small, so that you and your loved ones can always have access to it safely and securely

- Principles on how to create financial wellbeing in your life so you can have more, be more and do more with what you’ve got

- How to put a plan in place for your financial future

There will also be a Q&A session with the experts and an opportunity to network with like-minded and successful professional women.

Speakers on the day:

Lavinia D. Osbourne is a Blockchain and Crypto enthusiast, as well as a Financial Wellbeing coach and consultant. She is founder and host of Women in Blockchain Talks, a platform to elevate women in the Blockchain sphere by shining a light on their work and voices,

Jolita Kajtazi Is a Partner at Sheridans, a leading London law firm whose lawyers combine their in-depth legal knowledge and breadth of expertise and experience required to give unparalleled advice to their clients.

Mia Mohamed has 20 years of successful marketing experience working within the financial services and technology sectors globally. She is currently Head of Product Marketing at Trustology, a crypto custodial wallet provider that prioritises safeguarding your crypto assets' private keys for peace of mind in crypto investing.

Rebecca Robertson is an Independent Financial Advisor, she has over 18 years of financial services industry in a variety of management and advisor roles. She set up her own advisory Evolution Financial Planning in 2011 with the aim of enabling women and their families to take control of their finances and achieve long-term financial security.

This event is kindly sponsored by Sheridans - (https://www.sheridans.co.uk)

events.name: Crypto Mondays: Ethereum Introduction

Welcome to the Blockchain Centre's Crypto Monday series featuring Ethereum.

Come on down to the Blockchain Centre for an hour to receive a broad overview of Ethereum.

Ethereum has been cracking onwards for a few years now, and recently has been making headlines with things like the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance, and the recent 4x price surge of it's base token, Ether. If you feel like you're not quite sure why any of this is happening or what it all means, this is the session for you.

The session will be one hour. The provisional format is:

• 20 minute general guide to what Ethereum is

• 10 minute Q&A

• 20 minute demonstration about what Ethereum can be used for

• 10 minute Q&A

The demo isn't going to be interactive, so don't worry about bringing laptops.

events.name: 8LU Workshop w/ Paul Cowgill: Ethereum 101
events.description:
Join us Friday, December 13th for an 8th Light University workshop by Paul Cowgill!

Ethereum 101

---

SCHEDULE:

12:15 - 12:30: Lunch Service
12:30 - 1:30: Workshop
1:30: Questions/Networking

ABOUT THE WORKSHOP:

This workshop/talk will cover the different components of the crypto (web3) tech stack and the current state of the art using the Ethereum blockchain.

In this workshop/talk, we'll:

• Explore some data on the blockchain visually.
• Hear a few arguments for why this tech/movement matters.
• Try out a couple of particularly useful dapps (decentralized apps) together.
• Receive an introduction to the concept of gas.
• Learn about good practices for reading and writing data, indexing data, etc.

SPEAKER:

Paul is a software engineer, engineering leader, and entrepreneur. He specializes in blockchain and crypto - Ethereum, to be specific. As a freelancer, he worked on the OpenZeppelin 2.0 smart contract audit as well as a few other audits, did some smart contract development work for Dharma, and built the front end for a MetaCartel project. He is building an open-source project called Tasit for building native mobile Ethereum dapps - this project is funded in part through the Gnosis GECO program. Previously, he was the first employee and CTO at a YC-backed B2C mobile-first IoT startup, Edyn.

---

Lunch will be provided by 8th Light (https://8thlight.com/).

As this is a hands-on workshop, this event will not be streamed or recorded.

Want to learn more about 8th Light? Hang out after the presentation to chat with one of our crafters and find out how 8th Light is changing the software community.

events.name: Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Fundamentals Certification Workshop
events.description:
***PLEASE NOTE: YOU MUST PURCHASE TICKETS ON EVENTBRITE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/blockchain-and-cryptocurrency-fundamentals-certification-workshop-tickets-82012061283?aff=ebdssbdestsearch ***

Learn the fundamentals of blockchain and cryptocurrency in an interactive 2 day workshop with world-renowned expert instructor George Levy

About this Event

This 2 day educational workshop is a hands-on interactive learning experience with a world leading expert in blockchain and cryptocurrency. With your participation, you will earn a blockchain-verified certificate of completion on Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Fundamentals from leading educational organizations Blockchain Institute of Technology and blocksEDU which you can include on your resume, list on LinkedIn and add to your professional profile.

This program will provide you with all the key knowledge you will need to successfully engage in professional discussions on the topics of blockchain and cryptocurrency.

This is the same curriculum and learning program delivered to senior level executives at major leading organizations including Fannie Mae, Ernst & Young, the Ministry of Economy in Mexico, Glaxo Smith Kline and The Central Bank of Curacao among others.

Upon completion of the program, you will have a solid understanding of blockchain technology and cryptocurrency, including Bitcoin and Ethereum, as well as more advanced concepts such as smart contracts, DApps, cryptography, Initial Coin Offerings, and digital tokens among many others.

Learn the key aspects involved in blockchain and cryptocurrency, including:

 What is blockchain and how does it work?

 What is cryptocurrency and how many different kinds are there?

 What is Bitcoin and its history

 How does Public Key cryptography work and why does it matter?

 What are leading use cases of blockchain beyond Bitcoin?

 How are blockchain and Bitcoin related, and why is it so important to know the relation

 What are common misconceptions about blockchain and Bitcoin

 How can you get started with and acquire Bitcoin?

 How to use Bitcoin and cryptocurrency safely and effectively

And many more….

Take a look at the 2 day agenda in the graphic provided above, and enroll now as space is very limited in this hands-on, interactive workshop.

The instructor will be George Levy.

George Levy is a bestselling instructor and speaker focused on blockchain and cryptocurrency. As Division Head, Blockchain at blocksEDU and Chief Learning Officer at Blockchain Institute of Technology, George helps organizations understand and envision what is possible with blockchain technology, and effectively translate that knowledge into positive business results.

George has taught over 50,000 students in more than 180 countries, with clients ranging from senior level executive teams at the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae), and Ernst & Young, to the Ministry of Economy in Mexico and many others.

As a blockchain and cryptocurrency expert speaker, he has been a featured speaker at numerous leading events the world over including highly specialized events such as Supply Chain 2.0 in Miami, Florida to the d10e Conference on Decentralization in Tel Aviv, Israel.
