events.name: Become Blockchain Certified Solution Architect in 30 hours
events.description:
Course Description
This course describes the architectural and technical issues that must be considered before launching a blockchain development program. There are many decisions and issues that face a new project team. They include:

- Is a blockchain the right solution? Would a distributed database or other technology be adequate?
If so, what type of blockchain should be used? Should a blockless solution be used?
- Should the solution be an open or closed blockchain?
- Who are the participants in the blockchain?
- What consensus models and trust algorithm should be used?
- What development platform should be used?
- Should it be open source platform like BigChainDB, Elements Blockchain Platform, Eris:db, Multichain , Openchain, Quorum or Sawtooth Lake, Stellar.
- Should a commercial development platform like Chain Core, Corda, - Credits, Domus Tower Blockchain, Ethereum, HydraChain, Hyperledger - Fabric, Hyperledger Iroha, Hyperledger or Symbiont Assembly be used?
- What sort of architectural and resource capabilities and constraints should be considered in making the early decisions that will have dramatic impact on the success of the project.

This course is intended for technical leaders who must make technical decisions about architecture, environment and development platforms.

Course objectives
This instructor-led 30 hour Blockchain Solution Architect course is for technical leaders who need to make decisions about architecture, environment, and development platforms. The Government Blockchain Association Certified Blockchain Solution Architecture exam is included with class. The class covers the following topics:

What is Blockchain
- How does Blockchain work
- Types of Blockchains
- How is Blockchain different from what we have today
- What are use cases for Blockchain
- What does a Blockchain app look like
- How do I design a Blockchain app
- How do I develop a Blockchain app
- How do I test a Blockchain app

Class schedule:
30 hours in 3 days (Mon-Wed) from 8 am-6 pm

Course fee:
$1,200 online or $1,900 in DC

Class location:
online, DC or VA

For more info and RSVP:
https://myhsts.org/course-blockchain-certified-solution-architect-for-technical-leaders.php

events.name: Building a robust and cost-effective compliance risk management system
events.description:
Join us for our last CryptoMondays in 2019!!
All too often we see exciting new business ideas clash against an archaic system of financial regulations. The goal of this presentation is to show a case study of three service providers that work together to provide a turn-key, end-to-end compliance solution for the needs of companies operating in the blockchain space. We will show you how state and federal licensing, Know-Your-Customers, Anti-Money Laundering, Anti-Terrorist Financing, Identity Theft, International Sanctions, reporting, auditing, and issue resolution can all be managed with one integrated solution.

About our speakers:
Lorenzo Delzoppo, Managing Partner Corisma
Lorenzo is a New York attorney with 20 years of substantial regulatory compliance, risk management, and legal experience. He began his career in the regulatory field as AML/BSA Compliance Officer. After that role, he supervised compliance with all laws and regulations applicable to international money transfer activities as Chief Compliance Officer of a U.S. financial institution with subsidiaries in Portugal, Spain and the UK. In 2006, he joined Community Bank of Florida as BSA Officer and was soon promoted CCO. In 2012, he assumed the additional role of Chief Risk Officer. He was responsible for leading and coordinating company-wide risk management efforts by directly managing the Enterprise Risk Management platform and supervising the Compliance Management System. In addition to permanent internal control functions, his accountabilities included strategy development, regulators relations, external auditors and counsels’ coordination. In 2016, he moved to the consulting business where he has been advising law firms, financial institutions and fintech businesses on a broad spectrum of compliance and regulatory matters.

Albert Rodriguez, Principal Corisma
Albert brings a wealth of experience in banking, business, operations management, compliance, organizational development, and project management. Utilizing 25 years of extensive experience in the financial services industry, he has provided significant value to various financial institutions and organizations throughout his career. Additionally, he has worked in the development of software, led implementation projects, and developed training programs and curricula.

Jaime Ramirez, Founder/Chairman Preventor
Jaime Ramirez is a RegTech leader, serial entrepreneur, angel investor, and executive professional with over 30+ years of experience in Business, Banking, MSB, FinTech, RegTech, and Information Technology. He has specialized for the last 18 years on the design and development of Financial Crime Risk Management, Anti-Money Laundering, Fraud Prevention, and Compliance solutions. Currently Founder and CEO of Preventor, a RegTech enterprise focused on the identity management and Financial Crime Risk Management platform, delivering superior identity, privacy, KYC, anti-money laundering and monetary surveillance capabilities.

Blair Cohen, Founder/President AuthenticID
Since 2011, Cohen has focused on developing a vastly better method to authenticate identity than what presently exists. This led to the formation of authenticID in early 2012. Today, authenticID’s novel identity proofing products - catfishID and pictureID - are unparalleled in their innovation and effectiveness. Setting the new industry standard of excellence, catfishID forensically examines all government issued IDs and automatically determines the authenticity of the ID presented in under an astounding 9 seconds. catfishID’s accuracy is unmatched and the solution works with both driver’s licenses and passports - worldwide.

Thank you to our sponsor:
Co.Ris.Ma. Solutions
Our firm provides consulting services advising and assisting domestic and foreign law firms, financial institutions, and tech companies on a broad spectrum of legal and compliance matters, including financial regulations, financial crime, ethics, and corporate governance.

Blockchain technology can be defined as an open, distributed ledger that can record transactions between two parties efficiently and in a verifiable and permanent way. Real Estate is one of the leading industries this technology is looking to disrupt and bring true innovation to. Regardless of whether you're a loan officer, real estate agent/broker, or title/escrow agent, this technology is working to speed up real estate transactions while ensuring the transfer of information is secure and the parties involved are protected. Join us as Spencer Lyon from Realdax shows you how this technology is already benefiting your business and how you take advantage of the things that can put money in your pocket today. As members of the Miami Association of Realtors, you already have the ability to work with buyers and sellers who want to use cryptocurrency for their transactions by using Realdax to support you through the process. Don't miss the chance to learn how to expand your business and clientele by understanding the ways you can work with cryptocurrency in your business today.

events.description: This event is for anyone interested in becoming part of the emerging Cryptocurrency and Blockchain economy. CryptoMondays is a global brand existing in 37 other cities in 14 different countries, Miami is proud to be the 22nd chapter. Our goal is to build a strong community, foster an environment for strategic partnerships and make friends you can connect with across the globe. Miami is also a prime location to aide the disruption this new technology will have on the nation, at CryptoMondays we intend to build the local community as well as educate and ensure that Florida remains a central location for development. Download the Freebee app (blue and lime green) for one Free Drink and free rides around the city from electric vehicles. For more information, please reach out to one of the organizers and join our telegram channel https://t.me/BitcoinCenterMiami

events.name: Fireside Chat w/ Nick Kammerman, Chairman Connecticut Blockchain Working Group
events.description:
About the Connecticut Blockchain Working Group:
Created by CT State Senator Scott Frantz and other members of the Commerce Committee (CT Senate Bill No. 443, Special Act No. 18-8), the working group is seeking to create legislation focused on making Connecticut a desirable state to conduct business featuring blockchain technology. Experts with knowledge in business, education, and technology are working closely with state legislators in order to create proposals that will advance the expansion of the growing blockchain industry in the state. We will also recommend policies and investments in an effort to make Connecticut a beacon for blockchain.

• What we'll do - We'll hang with others as passionate about Crypto as we are. We'll drink, we'll laugh, we'll learn, we'll have fun, we'll make the world a better place.
• What to bring - Money for drinks
• Important to know - The venue will fill up, so get there early

Agenda:
6:30PM - Informal socializing & networking
7:15PM - Featured Guest & Content
7:45PM - Informal socializing & networking

While the event is free, attendees should expect to purchase their own food/drinks.

Organized by Ken Chapman
https://www.linkedin.com/in/ken-chapman
events.how_to_find_us: The event is located at MacDuffs Public House in Greenwich at 99 Railroad Ave.  MacDuff's is located within easy walking distance from the Greenwich train station.

events.name: Healthcare Lecture Series: Impact of Artificial Intelligence & Blockchain

group.name: Blockchain NYC - Blockchain | AI | Data Science

events.description:
A full day of educational lectures from industry luminaries on the impact of AI and blockchain in the healthcare space. Ample breaks for networking for those looking for deal making and opportunities.

MC: Dimitrios Tsakos
Opening Remarks: Jamiel Shiekh (9am-9:20am)

History of AI & Healthcare: Vadim Shepel, Director, Strategy & Consulting, Hospital and Vaccine Business Units, Pfizer (9:20am-9:40am)

Event Keynote: Michael Dershem, CEO of MAPay, LLC (9:40am - 10:30am)

"Lecture 1: 10:30am - 11:15am
Lauren Huber, Corporate Innovation, IBM
Blockchain in Healthcare: Industry Trends & Perspectives"

"Lecture 2: 11:15am-noon
Michael Frank, Director, R&D Strategy & Consulting, Pfizer
Getting to Proof of Innovation: AI Applications in Biopharma"

Break

"Panel: Why Healthcare Might The Next Biggest Blockchain Disruptor (1pm - 2pm) A discussion of why and how blockchain may disrupt healthcare, and how healthcare may disrupt blockchain.
Peter Borovych, Blockchain Solution Architect, Blockchain Driven
Dr. Lishan Aklog, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at PAVmed Inc., Medical Device Entrepreneur, Cardiac Surgeon
Alex Cahana, Head of Healthcare and Blockchain Consulting at Genesis Block
Moderated by Marcos Dinnerstein, Founding Editor: A Better Mousetrap Newsletter"

"Lecture 3: 2pm-2:45pm
Niteen Kumar, Enterprise Architect & Solution Architect, Amitech Solutions
Hospital Readmissions: Prediction and Management of Patient Readmission Risk"

Lecture 4: 2:45pm-3:30pm: Being confirmed

Networking Break (3:30pm-4pm)

"Lecture 5: 4pm-4:45pm
Alex Cahana, Head of Healthcare and Blockchain Consulting at Genesis Block. Blockchain Expert UN/CEFACT, Economic Commission Europe
PGOs, PBMs, payers and hospitals: Why nobody in Healthcare wants Blockchain"

Closing Remarks: Dimitrios Tsakos

events.name: Bitcoin Bay Kitchener-Waterloo
events.description:
The Bitcoin Bay is Toronto’s longest running and most popular blockchain and cryptocurrency meetup. Our goal is to foster education, innovation, and networking for like-minded people in the technology & greater regional communities. We hold meetups in downtown Toronto, Mississauga, and Kitchener

Community meetups are a big part of blockchain and cryptocurrency technology. We interact with others to ask questions and talk about different ideas and projects to build a more robust ecosystem.

In the future we hope to build an inclusive, blockchain-agnostic, and flourishing community in Waterloo Region. Beyond our regional, provincial, and national borders - The Bitcoin Bay has been able to establish a flourishing WhatApp community from all over the globe. Be sure to ask about these groups to be added to them at our meetups

group.name: Blockchain NYC - Blockchain | AI | Data Science

events.description:
RSVP via EventBrite only :)
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-blockchain-masterclass-certificate-nyc-tickets-81377386955

New topics added: Libra, stablecoins, STOs, skip lists and DEX architectures

OVERVIEW

Come and join us in the most popular blockchain masterclass in NYC - Understand blockchain from the inside out directly from practitioners with proven track records and deep real-world experience. Network with industry professionals in an engaging, stimulating and immersive full day masterclass taught by an NYU professor, blockchain architect and global speaker.

Expect about 8 hours of instruction time that often goes past 5.30pm, heavy engagement, Q&A and student interaction. The learning will be intense, fun, current and engaging. Our course material is actively revised, no two classes are identical.

Full Details: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-blockchain-masterclass-certificate-nyc-tickets-81377386955

group.name: Blockchain Music Cryptocurrency for Musicians & Developers

events.description:
PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS A TICKETED EVENT YOU MUST BOOK @UNIVERSE https://fin.sv/2V3UDC5

Women speak out about Opportunities & Issues in Blockchain! #blockchainwomen

Launching an STO or got a FinTech startup? Book a demo table & get a video of your 3min pitch! Past pitches have thousands hits on their videos!

Want to pay with Cryptocurrency? Pay for Tickets Here https://fin.sv/2rqSoue

Emi Yoshikawa Senior Director Global Operations Ripple Emi is responsible for expanding Ripple's businesses into strategic international markets and managing joint venture partnership. Prior to Ripple, she led the product development of quants investment analytics at MSCI, which was previously part of Morgan Stanley, and ran a cross-border business consulting firm based in Silicon Valley. In 2017, she was selected as a top-50 "Women in Fintech" Influencer by Onalytica in 2017. Emi holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and is also a CFA charterholder.
Betsabe Botaitis CoFounder/CFO AIKON, a technology company providing blockchain identity as a service. As a leading international fintech expert and an advocate for economic equality, Betsabe has held various senior positions at renowned and leading-edge organizations including Kueski, Mexico’s largest fintech startup, Lending Club, largest peer to peer lending marketplace, and Citigroup, at Citi Community Development and Financial Inclusion. Today, Betsabe brings her fintech expertise and lifelong mission together as founder of AIKON to launch new technology with the power to dismantle biases from opportunity and innovation worldwide. Betsabe has served on the advisory board at the Nasdaq Entrepreneurial Center, is a fellow for the British America Project and a member of Hipower.
Brynly LLyr General Counsel C Labs which is working on a full stack, mobile first blockchain solution for developing markets. This open source project is Celo, with a mission is to build a monetary system that creates the conditions of prosperity for everyone. Before her work on Celo, Brynly was General Counsel at Ripple Labs Inc. (“Ripple”), a global enterprise software and cryptocurrency company focused on cross-border payments. While at Ripple, Brynly built and led the legal, compliance, regulatory and government relations teams, led communications with the New York Department of Financial Services and other regulatory agencies and successfully managed and settled key litigation. Before joining Ripple, Brynly was senior counsel at PayPal and eBay for over five years, where she developed payments and regulatory expertise, managed complex litigation, led cross-functional teams and specialized and participated in areas including commercial negotiations, mergers and acquisitions, and patent strategy.
Olga V. Mack CEO Parley Pro, a next-generation contract management company that has pioneered online negotiation technology. Olga embraces legal innovation and had dedicated her career to improving and shaping the future of law. She is convinced that the legal profession will emerge even stronger, more resilient, and more inclusive than before by embracing technology.
Moderator: Yasamin Parsafar Associate IP Sheppard Mullin Yasamin is based in the firm's San Francisco office and is Lead Associate of the firm’s Blockchain Technology & Digital Currency team and a member of the Cannabis and esports teams. Yasamin’s practice focuses on protecting her clients’ intellectual property rights through counseling, prosecution, enforcement and litigation.
6:30pm to 7:00pm Networking
7:00pm to 8:00pm panel
8:00pm to 8:30pm STOs & Blockchain startups Demo Pitches/Networking

Completion of course will result in a certificate of completion stored on the blockchain

Welcome to the new you. Cape and all. For those new to Python, Python beginners or even those with some Python skills. This is a 20 day course with 5 consecutive days on-site (classroom) and 15 days off-site for project work with grading.

This is an action-packed Python intensive that will take you from beginner to pro faster than the release of yet another Avengers sequel. This one week course is a easily costs over $5,000 at top-tier universities and you get it for a fraction of the cost.

Let your inner Wonder Woman shine.

events.name: ARTificial intelligence

group.name: Blockchain NYC - Blockchain | AI | Data Science

events.description:
“If you hear somebody playing a piano, would you ever say is the piano the artist?” - Mario Klingemann -

In October 2018 an AI artwork was sold at Christie’s for $432,500.

When we think about art made by Artificial Intelligence, we imagine a bot thinking and creating art: that is not what is happening.

Artists and creators have been pushing the limits experimenting with the use of machine learning.

Is AI an emotional entity or data that is trained by human emotions?

Is “Ai art” art?

These topics will be discussed by some of the most cutting edge figures in the art world.

MOCDA Museum of Digital Art

http://www.mocda.org

Dada

http://dada.nyc/home

David Young

http://triplecode.com

Helena Sarin

http://www.neuralbricolage.com

Travis LeRoy Southworth

http://travisleroysouthworth.com

Ben Snell

http://bensnell.io

Panel Moderator: Curator Eleonora Brizi

events.name: BerChain BlockBeers - Christmas edition
events.description:
Once more, before the end of the year we are hosting our BlockBeers for an evening full of blockchain, DLT, and decentralisation discussions and networking. Perhaps we manage to turn this into a real Christmas edition. While we work on the mulled wine (tbc), why don't you already unpack your ugly Christmas sweater?

BerChain is a non-profit, member-led organisation, focussed on connecting and promoting the Berlin blockchain ecosystem. We have nearly 35 members and organise a number of key events next to our community events throughout the year, and we offer unique opportunities to our members and serve the wider ecosystem.

Berlin is at the center of the blockchain ecosystem and has some of the key players located within its borders. BerChain meanwhile counts over 500 vetted blockchain professionals (sign up through berchain.com!)

Come network and have a BlockBeer with our team, our members and our wider community.

See you there!

events.name: Deep into Blockchain Series : How consensus enables democracy in Blockchain
events.description:
** Registrations using Google Form link **
If you believe in Decentralization technologies, have been learning/working on Blockchain and reached a stage where you feel like sharing your knowledge and listen from others who are as like minded as you..

You have come to the correct place to find such people.

We are working on gathering the best of minds interested in Blockchain to work together as a community. The objective is to engage with self initiated individuals who need not be spoon fed, but do their research and further their wisdom by discussing on the topic with others in the community. (please see the Infograph on how we plan to engage)

This Meetup is the first in series on a journey deep into Blockchain

The focus this instance is on Cryptography & Distributed Computing:

Importance of Consensus in context of Blockchain
What is Consensus and how it enables democratic decisioning & fairness in process?
Consensus Mechanism in public & private Blockchains
Pre & Post consensus state of a transaction
Comparison of consensus in various platforms
and much more..

Registrations - http://bit.ly/DeepBlockchainHyd

NO SPOT REGISTRATIONS PLEASE
events.how_to_find_us: Location shared via WhatsApp / Telegram

events.name: Chainlink Phoenix - Understanding the oracle problem - December 2019
events.description:
This meetup we will dive into the "oracle problem" and what Chainlink is doing in the oracle space.

This session is welcome to any experience level, but is specifically geared towards those who have zero existing knowledge of Blockchain or DLT.

Beginners welcome! We will discuss the core concepts of distributed ledger technology (DLT) and the exciting advancements it is bringing to a variety of markets.

If you are looking for a more technical meet up, or a session geared towards developers, next month's meet up will be just that. The Arizona Chainlink meetup events will rotate monthly between beginner focused topics and more advanced sessions.

There are also many great workshops online. Many of the past events have been recorded and are ready to watch on demand, or follow the official Chainlink Twitter or Chainlink Discord channel to hear about and register for upcoming live webinars when they are scheduled.

events.name: UnBlockingChain#6 - Cloud con Oracle  - Telefónica Trust OS - Experto Blockchain
events.description:
Unblocking Chain #6
Jueves 12 de Diciembre 2019. Sala 2.04 / Salón de Actos a 17:00 h

1. Plataforma Blockchain como Servicio Cloud con Oracle.
2. Telefónica Trust OS y Casos de éxito de Blockchain.
3. Presentación del II Título de Experto Universitario en Tecnologías de Blockchain.

En esta sesión conoceremos de primera mano las soluciones de blockchain de grandes empresas tecnológicas como Oracle y Telefónica (11Paths).
Estas soluciones están orientadas a una adopción e integración más fácil de la tecnología Blockchain, así como a una transformación más eficaz y profesional de los procesos y aplicaciones de cualquier negocio, permitiendo un procesamiento más rápido de las transacciones.

Contaremos con la participación de:
- Antonio Gómez, Principal Solution Engineer de Oracle:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/antonio-gomez-rodriguez-7832a4a/

- Marcos Arjona, Cybersecurity Innovation & Research Booster de Telefónica - ElevenPaths:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/marcosarjona/

Tanto Antonio como Marcos formarán parte del plantel de profesores del "II Título Propio de Experto Universitario en Tecnologías de Blockchain", que dará comienzo a finales de Enero:
https://www.nics.uma.es/Blockchain
También durante esta sesión, Javier López, director de este Título de Experto de la UMA, realizará una presentación de los contenidos y temporización de esta segunda edición.

events.name: [Hashed Lounge #25] The Year-End Meetup
events.description:
# Hashed Lounge 소개

Hashed Lounge는 전세계 블록체인 시장의 혁신적인 기술과 프로젝트를 커뮤니티에 소개하고 교류하는 밋업입니다. 탈중앙화된 미래를 꿈꾸는 많은 분들과 함께 재미있는 커뮤니티를 만들어가고 싶습니다.

[Hashed Community Channels]

Hashed Medium (ENG): https://medium.com/hashed-official
Hashed Medium (KOR): https://medium.com/hashed-kr
Hashed Telegram: https://t.me/hashedchannel
Hashed Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hashedfund

# Hashed Lounge: The Year-End Meetup에 초대합니다!

2019년 한 해 동안 해시드는 블록체인 시장에서 어떤 기회들을 발견했을까요? 그리고 앞으로 다가오는 2020년에는 무슨 일들이 기다리고 있을까요? 해시드는 하루가 다르게 발전하는 블록체인 기술이 곧 우리 삶의 많은 부분에 접목되고, 미래사회의 중요한 축이 될 것이라고 믿고 있습니다. 이번 행사에 함께하셔서 해시드가 바라보는 미래의 모습을 함께 살펴보고 이야기 나누었으면 합니다.

# 행사 프로그램

7:00 PM ~ 7:05 PM: Opening Remarks, 김서준 대표
7:05 PM ~ 7:25 PM: 블록체인 게임시장의 현황, 김균태 파트너
7:25 PM ~ 7:35 PM: NOD Games, 이찬기 대표
7:35 PM ~ 7:55 PM: CeFi 101, 김성호 파트너
7:55 PM ~ 8:15 PM: 디파이(DeFi)에 주목해야 하는 이유, 김경진 심사역
8:15 PM ~ 8:35 PM: Panel Session
8:35 PM ~ 9:00 PM: 네트워킹

# Meetup 참가 안내

• 장소: 해시드 라운지 (서울특별시 강남구 테헤란로 4길14 미림타워 3층)
• 시간: 2019년 12월 17일 화요일, 19:00 ~ 21:00
• 인원: 100명
• 참가비: 무료

- 본 행사는 한국어로 진행되며, 별도의 통역이 없습니다.
- 본 행사에서는 간단한 음식이 준비되어 있습니다.
- 참가 등록이 확정되신 분들에 한해서 참석 가능합니다.

events.name: Hyperledger Blockchain [frameworks and use-cases] Meetup
events.description:
We will discuss the general topic of Blockchain for beginner in the first half of the disucssion.

Then we will make an introductory to Hyperledger Blockchain Frameworks and what are the different use-cases used for each framework.

This will be a good opportunity for you to become familiar with Hyperledger Organization and it's frameworks. Most important the amazing efforts being contributed to building these frameworks for opensource.

If you are interested to learn about Blockchain Networks and would like to get a better understanding then this workshop is for you!

This will also be a good chance for us to have a discussion around the benefits of the technology for our country with current developments. And I personally am excited to meet some of you for the first time.

We hope to conduct the Meetup monthly to get the community to be more active in the Saudi Blockchain space.

Looking forward to meet you all :)
events.how_to_find_us: Entry from parking area behind the building in the left corner. 3rd floor.

events.name: Blazor & WebAssembly
events.description:
Blazor is the answer of Microsoft to create modern and flexible web applications. Blazor belongs to the opensource AspNetCore framework. What makes Blazor special? We think the possibility to build WebAssemblies, the ability to code in C# instead of JavaScript and the server and client mode.
Martin Kräuchi will show you the key elements of Blazor in a practical step by step approach (no C# knowledge necessary). By interest he also will give us a glimpse to azure storage queues and azure serverless computing (azure functions).
Bring in your laptop, food and drinks are offered. Usually we hack until 10-11 p.m. creating some kind of more or less meaningful applications. Feel free to join us as long as your batteries allow :)

events.name: Google AI Tech Talk: Building real time cross platform video audio ML pipelines
events.description:
Join us this Google AI tech talk event:

Topic:
MediaPipe: Building real time cross platform video audio ML pipelines

Abstract:
Video, audio (multimodal) mobile and edge use cases that utilize machine learning models (eg Tiktok, Shazam, Google Home Hub) are becoming more common. However, creating these multimodal ML applications are challenging as developers need to deal with real time synchronization of time series data during model inference and doing it cross platform on mobile and edge devices.
Google open sourced in Jun 2019, MediaPipe (https://mediapipe.dev), a cross platform applied machine learning pipeline framework that simplifies the development process. My talk will be introducing open source MediaPipe framework, walking through mobile and edge (EdgeTPU coral) demos and getting developers started on building multimodal ML applications

https://mediapipe.page.link/handgoogleaiblog

Speaker:
Ming Yong is a Product manager in Google Research Perception Research leading open source efforts in computer vision. In Google, he was previously product manager in Google Search and product lead for mobile video ad formats. Before Google, Ming was cofounder Socialwok, an enterprise collaboration service for Google Apps (Finalist of the Techcrunch Disrupt 2011) and Voiceroute, a startup focused on open source VOIP telephony services for small medium enterprises.

Direction:
The meeting room is on 3rd floor, Beach Huts

events.name: A Bitcoin Remittance Chat With InstaCrypto CEO!!!!

venue.name: Online Hangout Meeting!
venue.address_1: Hangout Link will be sent before the meetup.

events.description:
Details
The Agenda: Instant Crypto Remittance catching up Worldwide.

Bitcoin & Cryptocurrency's Most Effective Use: The $600 Billion Global Remittance

India is expected to retain the top spot among remittance recipients, with a projected figure of $65 billion, while China ($63 billion), the Philippines ($33 billion), Mexico ($31 billion), and Nigeria ($22 billion) hold the next spots on the list.

A peer-to-peer system known as blockchain is responsible for running Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency. Transactions using the digital currency are recorded in the ledger, and no one entity is tasked with managing it. Essentially, when a transaction occurs, the records on the ledger adjust accordingly.

The World Bank estimates that 10% of global remittance is eaten up in fees. That’s a scandalously high figure and must be reduced. We sincerely hope that distributed ledger technologies will move us towards a seamless, legal and inexpensive way to transmit this value using InstaCrypto and our users can profit from it. The profit is seen most times because crypto is at a premium in india consistently. But for now, we need to work with this constraint — any disruption to the status quo only makes sense if it delivers a fee load lower than 10% of value transmitted.

group.name: Democratic AI Ecosystem by bitgrit | Global

events.description:
The competition will ask our extensive network of data scientists to create an AI algorithm to implement in a foreign exchange system using historical media, news, and exchange data. The awards for this competition will add up to a total of $10,000 USD. The competition is scheduled to start on November 1 and finish on December 31, with the winners announced on January 31
When it comes to foreign exchange, a major issue facing organizations and individuals alike is an ever-fluctuating exchange rate. Knowing how much a transaction will cost in one currency only to have the exchange rate change rapidly in a 24-hour period can cost companies gargantuan amounts of money. An exchange rate difference of $0.01 doesn’t mean much when exchanging smaller sums, but as the amount of money exchanged increases, so do the stakes.

events.name: Performance-based service agreement – DLT solution for an Industrial IoT problem

group.name: IOTA Foundation Beyond Blockchain Meetup Chicago

events.description:
Description
A large share of every OEM’s revenues come from service and repair, but a lot of time end efforts are wasted in identifying the cause of a problem after a breakdown. Currently only a small portion of machines in the field is IoT-ready, which makes it challenging for OEMs to “point the finger” and determine whether a repair should be under warranty or paid service.

Subject Area
DLT, IIoT, manufacturing, Industry4.0, business model innovation

Event Description
During the course of this event we will demonstrate how it is possible to combine Distributed Ledger Technologies with the Internet of Things domain in order to come up with complex solutions to manufacturing problems that could not be solved using other tools. A number of Industry4.0 use cases will be also discussed and as well as a live demo running at the Chicago Connectory.

Agenda
- DLT+IIoT Use Cases presentation
- Performance-based service agreement focused use case
- Open discussion and live demo

Bio
Matteo Dariol is a Lead Innovation Strategist for Bosch Rexroth. He is located in Bosch’s innovation and co-creation space within Chicago historic Merchandise Mart, called Chicago Connectory, a joint venture between the German corporation and 1871. His activities revolve around the intersection between R&D and product development, with the goal of looking outside Bosch Rexroth’s core business and identifying new technologies and new business models. Currently his areas of expertise are serverless cloud software architectures, artificial intelligence (AI) applied to manufacturing, industrial IoT (IIoT), distributed ledger technologies (DLT) and business model innovation.

events.description:
제12회 코스모스 밋업 "블록체인 상호호환성"을 개최합니다.

코스모스의 메인넷을 넘어 다가오고 있는 큰 혁신은 블록체인 상호호환성입니다. IBC를 핵심으로 다양한 형태의 블록체인간 통신을 가능하게 하고, 이를 통해 다양한 애플리케이션이 만들어지는 진정한 '블록체인의 인터넷'이 빠르게 다가오고 있습니다.

백서에서 단순한 토큰 전송만을 위해 제시되었던 IBC는 이제 블록체인간 스마트 컨트랙트 호출, 샤딩, NFT 전송 등 수 많은 적용사례를 고려하여 개발되고 있습니다.

블록체인 상호호환성의 선두주자 코스모스 생태계 내에서 진행되고 있는 다양한 Interoperability 기술과 프로젝트를 논의하는 유익한 시간이 되시기를 바랍니다.

1. 장소: 논스 제네시스 / 서울특별시 강남구 봉은사로22길 45-9 (강남구 역삼동[masked])

6. 회기순서:
7:15 - 7:30pm, 등록 및 리셉션
7:30 - 7:50pm, 코스모스 IBC를 소개합니다 (Dogemos | Tendermint)

events.description:
BOOK YOUR SLOT HERE! 🔽
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/singapore-crypto-mining-meetup-30-how-to-generate-passive-income-through-crypto-mining-tickets-50992772756

Hello Crypto Enthusiasts!

The Singapore Crypto Mining Meet Up is a venue for you to explore and understand the outlook of the blockchain and cryptocurrency technology. The meet up will focus on the most crucial part of the space - crypto mining.

Despite the volatility of cryptocurrency, crypto mining is a lucrative industry that is growing and crypto mining businesses like Bitmain which is among the most valuable blockchain companies ever created because of their strong cashflow and profitability.

If you are considering to venture into the lucrative crypto mining, the event will cover a beginner’s guide to crypto mining, and also ways to identify common cryptocurrency scams.

Come and join us as you might be surprised by how easy you can be part of this revolutionary space!

Our Featured Speaker:

Nicole Goh - She is the Director of Business Development of Minerium, and also a tech executive. She was previously the Strategic Partnership Manager for Compare Asia Group in Malaysia, a Series B funded company backed by Goldman Sachs, International Finance Corporation and Alibaba Entrepreneurs Fund, whereby she was responsible for establishing sales verticals and developing strategic expansion plan. Prior to this, she was involved in a private equity deal origination business, advocacy and finance. She holds a BSc (Hons) in Accounting and Finance, affiliated with Lancaster University (UK).

Event Organiser & Sponsor:

Minerium is a crypto mining technology firm, that runs large scale cloud mining centres across the globe. With its cryptomining farms set up in Malaysia, Canada and Mongolia, Minerium brings crypto mining efficiency to the forefront at the optimum international locations where low cost energy is readily available. Minerium was launched in October 2017, and received investment and support from sophisticated tech institutional investor such as Fatfish Internet Group (ASX:FFG), which has multiple investments in the consumer internet and blockchain sectors around the world.

FatFish Internet Group (ASX:FFG) is a global tech venture investment and development firm. Fatfish is the first of its kind to list on the Australian Securities Exchange. Fatfish partners with entrepreneurs to facilitate tech venture building with the potential to scale regionally or globally through its unique “Seed-to-Exit” approach. Fatfish has been actively investing in the blockchain and crypto space across major global hubs.

events.name: (paid) online AI course:Practical Machine Learning in Python

group.name: Salt Lake City AI Developers Group

events.description:
We are starting a new course to learn machine learning by building projects with python. This course is online live course, 3 weeks, 2 sessions/week. You can listen, watch, interact, Q&A with instructors from anywhere around the world. Miss the live session due to time zone or conflict? learn session replay any time afterwards.

Course Name: Practical Machine Learning in Python
Start date: Jan. 15, 2:30pm PT (US pacific time, check your local time zone).
* 6 sessions, 12 hours
* 6 live lectures, 6 hands-on code labs.
* Live Sessions, Real time interaction
* Forum supports to projects and homework

enrollment:
https://learn.xnextcon.com/course/coursedetails/C20011514

Details:
In this course you will learn the fundamentals of Machine Learning primarily through a series of hands on exercises guided by the instructor. Students will learn about the foundational underpinnings of machine learning as well as how to put that knowledge to the test with practical exercises.
The course takes unique project focused approach to teach you machine learning by building machine learning models. The instructor will walk you through a series of curated projects, and explain the key concepts as they arise. Students will learn the theory and how these models work under the hood while writing code.

Students who take this course will be able to:
* Identify and frame problems that can be solved by machine learning
* Choose the right techniques to the problems
* Understand key machine learning concepts and how algorithms / models work
* Identify and fix problems with messy datasets
* Build and training various models with sklearn
* Troubleshoot and improve models
* Discuss the parts and processes involved in building large scale machine learning applications

Online AI tech talks, courses, bootcamps : https://learn.xnextcon.com

events.name: Crypto Happy Hour & Comedy Night
events.description:
Welcome to SF's first Crypto Happy Hour and Comedy night. Whether you're a Crypto pro, or just want dinner and comedy - we encourage you to come and mix, mingle and laugh with us at this fun and informative event!

TIMELINES

6 pm until 7 pm

Crypto Happy Hour - mix & mingle

7 pm until 10 pm

Comedy Incubator (includes intermission)

Comedy Couch SF

Comedy Couch SF is a volunteer run organization that was founded by NY Transplant Rose Hienz and SF Native and Kip Fuller in May 2017. Today, Rose and Kip are widely known for producing some of SF's funniest, hippest and most diverse participatory Comedy Incubators and stand up comedy shows. Comedians Daniele Midi-Mindix, Rose Hienz and Kip Fuller will host the Happy Hour as well as the Comedy Incubator show.

SF Blockchain collective

Co-host Gee Sivalingam is the founder of SF Blockchain collective, which provides Crytpo Currency education. Gee is a fun guy and once tried stand up comedy in a past life.

Serendipia

Co-host Jean Loick Michaux is the co-founder of the Crypto based Serendipia community mentioned here in the San Francisco Chronicle. His community is very cool, and fosters a culture that supports Crytpo based creators and visionaries.

CHECK IN INSTRUCTIONS:

The Mixer begins at 6 PM but check-in time for the Comedy show begins at 7 pm. The Comedy room located towards the rear of the restaurant. To claim your seat enter the comedy room and walk to the front of the performance area and a host will ask your name and route you to a seat.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:

CAN I MAKE A DONATION USING CRYPTO or CASH?

Yes - we will accept Crypto and cash donations at each event!

IS THERE FOOD AND A FULL BAR?
Yes

IS THERE AN AGE REQUIREMENT?

The Comedy show is 18+ only.

IS THERE A DRINK MINIMUM?

No drink minimum

IS THERE PARKING AVAILABLE

There are many parking spaces nearby.

FURTHER QUESTIONS:

Email is at: [masked]
events.how_to_find_us: Meet us in the Comedy room at the back of the restaurant.

events.name: NJ Crypto Enthusiasts
events.description:
• What we'll discuss
We will be discussing the new digital money world of cryptocurrencies.
What is a cryptocurrency?
What is an exchange and where to go to set up accounts.
Cryptocurrency wallets, what they are, the types and basic security.
What is an ICO (initial coin offering) and how to get involved.
How to research, what to look for and where to find great information.
Trading Cryptocurrencies.
Mining Cryptocurrencies.
We will discuss how to take what you have learned and apply that knowledge using different formats and strategies to purchase Cryptos and make them grow!
We will share with you our experiences, the pitfalls to look out for and the paths to success.
NJ Crypto Enthusiasts are committed to helping you be a success!

• What to bring
A notebook or laptop, your questions & desire to learn!

• Important to know
We host our MeetUps at Panera Bread. It is because of their generosity that we are able to keep our meetings completely FREE and though it is not mandatory, Panera Bread appreciates your patronage. So have a drink, or have a snack, sit back relax and lets talk Crypto!

events.name: Learn about Binance chain, TrustWallet, Tellor, Agoric, and Cosmos
events.description:
In this meetup we discuss the latest from Binance Chain, TrustWallet, Tellor, and get a presentation on IBC from Cosmos/Agoric. Join us in building the decentralized future!

Food & drinks will be provided. There will be plenty of time for open discussion and networking. The event will start promptly at 6:30pm.

AGENDA AT A GLANCE

Arrival & Networking - 6:00-6:45pm
Teck (Binance X / Binance Chain) - 6:45-6:50pm
Viktor (Trust Wallet) - 6:50-7:00pm
Brenda (Tellor) - 7:05-7:15pm (video setup)
Zaki (Cosmos) & Dean (Agoric) (IBC presentation) - 7:15-7:45pm
Networking & close - 7:45-8:30pm

///
ABOUT BINANCE X
Binance X is a brand new developer-focused initiative aimed at fostering innovation on the Binance platform and the general ecosystem at large.

> Join our community: http://t.me/BinanceX_newsletter
> Follow us: https://twitter.com/binancex
> Learn more about Binance X: https://binancex.dev
> Learn more about Binance Chain: https://docs.binance.org/

///
ABOUT TRUST WALLET
TrustWallet a community-driven, completely open-source, multi-coin crypto wallet. It enables blockchain developers to build their dApps and wallets natively without having to worry about the low-level implementation details.

> Learn more about TrustWallet: https://trustwallet.com/
> Check out our developer website: https://trustwallet.com/developer

///
ABOUT TELLOR
Tellor is a decentralized oracle for DeFi. It's an easy to implement solution to get high-value data into your smart contracts.

> Learn more at: https://tellor.io/

///
ABOUT COSMOS
Cosmos is an open, distributed network of interoperable blockchains powered by the Tendermint consensus algorithm.

> Learn about the Cosmos vision: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Eb8xkDi_PUg
> Read more about Cosmos: https://cosmos.network/intro
> Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/cosmos?lang=en
> Join the discussion: https://riot.im/app/#/room/#cosmos:matrix.org
> More on IBC: https://cosmos.network/ibc

///
ABOUT AGORIC
Agoric is developing a secure distributed ocap platform for smart contracts and market-oriented programming. Their platform supports the development of smart contracts and market institutions across many different scales, from large public blockchains to small two-party contracts.

> Learn more at: https://agoric.com/about/

events.name: How Distributed IoT Solution Can Help in a More Connected World
events.description:
Presentation abstract —
Hedera is excited to team up with the DigitalOcean Amsterdam group for another educational meetup. This meetup will feature a presentation by Hedera ambassador Yudi Xu. In his presentation, Yudi will discuss solving security in IOT devices with distributed ledger technologies. Then it's the EOY quiz - a fun quiz with a bunch of cool prizes (usually we have big prizes from DigitalOcean too). Yudi is the co-founder of EVEC, former CTO advisor of Shell, and is now working on to bring trust into the Internet-of-Things.

As always, there will be beers, wine, and soft drinks. We'll start the night with snacks to keep you from fading away and end it with pizza. Simple food you can eat with one hand and hold a drink with the other. Whether you're a Meaty or Veggie or Vegan kinda person, there will be something for you to eat. Gluten free people too.

Feel free to wear your festive jumper/t-shirt too

RSVP Here: https://www.meetup.com/DigitalOceanAmsterdam/events/266866671/

Meetup agenda —
- 6:30 - Doors open - Grab a drink and get a seat
- 7:00 - Brief introduction
- 7:10 - Yudi Xu (EVEC) - How distributed IoT solution can help in a more connected world
- 7:50 - A short break
- 8:00 - End of Year Quiz
- 8:40 - Closing remarks then pizza and socializing

All attendees are subject to the Events Code of Conduct (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NEGQNUz8-36SAnOoW8GR_1iNyd4m1aT2CV1IZIlotKA/edit?usp=sharing). Please read before attending.

events.name: Crypto Coffee With Gary
events.description:
I host a meetup every Wednesday morning at the Urban Alchemy Coffee Bar in Arlington, Texas.

I enjoy this location, so I thought it would be a great place to sit, and have a cup of coffee while talking about Bitcoin and crypto.

Both novice and experts in the world of Bitcoin and Crypto should enjoy these morning meet ups.

As I start this up I don't really expect a lot of people to attend, but if you just want to sit down and have a cup of coffee while talking Bitcoin stop by for an hour and let's meet.

Just look for me sitting at a table drinking a cup of coffee.

Make sure and tell you friends and spread the word about the new Bitcoin Community in Arlington, Texas

I hope I see you there.

Take a look at https://ArlingtonCrypto.com

James Howells - one of the first Bitcoin miners

Shane Kehoe and Charles Storry from SVK Crypto

Grab your tickets now to confirm your place - they're free, but when they're gone, they're gone so snap 'em up while you can!

- ususret Shelley 2020 - do kud smo stigli i što možemo očekivati u razvoju Cardano platforme u 2020. godini
- uvod u smart contract platforme - tzv. blockchain 2. i 3. generacije.

Svi sudionici dobivaju prigodan poklon uz uvjet da se fotografiraju na zajedničkoj fotografiji 😀

Napomene
Ulaz je besplatan. Svatko plaća konzumaciju pića.
Parkiranje je moguće u okolnim ulicama uz naplatu (2. zona - 6 kn/sat).

Vidimo se uskoro,

Marin Kramarić, Cardano Ambassador

events.name: Blockchain ¿Circo de la innovación o motor de cambio?
events.description:
Desde el lanzamiento de la red de Bitcoin el 3 de enero de 2009 se han ido creando diferentes propuestas autodenomindas como Blockchain. Desde aquellas primeras, compuestas por criptomonedas, hasta las más recientes conocidas como DLTs que prescinden del concepto de token. Y es probable que en futuro asistamos a nuevas variantes que también se incluyan bajo el paraguas Blockchain .

En este meetup vamos a describir cuales son los factores que fomentan y motivan esta diversidad de pensamiento y cómo se traduce en lo que denominamos el circo de la innovación, tanto en el mundo Blockchain y DLT. Intentaremos responder a cuestiones como ¿por qué las grandes empresas necesitan invertir en una imagen de innovación? ¿cómo y por qué se implementan estos programas de innovación? ¿qué ecosistemas e incentivos se crean alrededor de estos ecosistemas? ¿qué dinámicas necesitamos en realidad para ser competitivos en un mundo de transformación acelerada?

Además, charlaremos sobre los aspectos fundamentales que hacen de blockchain una de las tecnologías más disruptivas en la actualidad y cómo puede influir en el desarrollo de las personas y las estructuras sociales, en una nueva sociedad “descentralizada”.

En esta ocasión contaremos con Alex Preukschat que realizará una presentación inicial de estos conceptos para después pasar a un debate abierto con el invitado del día: Alberto Gómez Toribio.

Alberto es el responsable de tecnología Blockchain en Bankia. Con anterioridad ha trabajado como experto en tecnología para organismos como el Ministerio del Interior o el Tribunal Supremo y en firmas privadas como Sony Entertainment o Telefónica I+D. Alberto se inició en Blockchain fundando Coinffeine en 2013, un exchange descentralizado de Bitcoin en el que Bankinter invirtió en 2014. En 2015 también creó una compañía de consultoría Blockchain desde la que ha lanzado proyectos y startups para grandes empresas del IBEX.

Duración: 90 minutos
Precio: Gratuito
Fecha: 21 de enero a las 18:45

Lugar: Life Ray - Paseo de la Castellana, 280, 28046 Madrid

Organizado por Blockchain España

events.name: Blockchain Startup Pitches - Zurich
events.description:
We are pleased and honoured to host the 'Blockchain Startup Pitches' event at our meetup.

Decentralization, blockchain, distributed ledgers, and crypto assets are all over the tech news. Meetings and conferences in New York and Hong Kong make us forget easily how decentralized the future of technology is. After all, great innovations can happen anywhere! This event brings together the Zurich blockchain community and those interested in the topic. 2-3 Blockchain startups from Zurich will give short presentations about their vision for the future - followed by drinks and a get-together.

This event is sponsored by BLOCKROCKET (blockrocket.io) - European Blockchain Labs. BLOCKROCKET supports and helps accelerate blockchain startups in launching and growing their business model by providing a platform based on top level co-working facilities in Frankfurt, Munich, and Berlin and connecting them to stakeholders relevant for their startups.

TICKETS
++++ The meetup is free of charge but there is a limited number of seats. Therefore, please RSVP your free spot on Eventbrite. This is important since you can only join the meetup with a valid Eventbrite ticket https://www.eventbrite.de/e/blockchain-startup-pitches-zurich-tickets-67785838267++++

TOPIC
Disrupt Meetup | Blockchain Startup Pitches - Zurich

SPEAKERS
Here is the current line-up of the upcoming speakers:

(1) David Geisser, Founder and CEO, CollectID (https://collectid.io)
David holds a Master’s degree in Business Innovation from the University of St. Gallen, where he did a one year program in Design Thinking in collaboration with Stanford University. As part of the program, he developed an MVP for a Swiss-based retail bank. After his studies, David joined Boydak Strategy Consulting where he focused on business model innovation and rapid prototyping. During this time, David led several projects and developed various MVPs for different clients.

(2) Eduardo Salazar, CEO, Forctis AG (https://forctis.io)
An economist engaged in macro-econometrics and applied mathematics, but perhaps more of a technologist on a daily basis, for over 30 years Eduardo has followed a career path involving broadly engaging, cross-disciplinary environments. His experience spans both academia and the private sector, as well as work for multilateral organizations such as the World Bank and the IADB.

(3) Nathan Worsley, Co-Founder and CTO, LocalCoinSwap (https://localcoinswap.com/en/)

Nathan Worsley is the Co-founder and Chief Technical Officer of LocalCoinSwap. In 2015 he founded the LocalCoinSwap project and was the first developer on the codebase. Although working full time on a technical startup, Nathan's educational background is in Economics and machine learning. Nathan has a passion for using Blockchain as a tool for promoting financial inclusivity. This passion has driven the LocalCoinSwap project to adapt and pivot in the ever-changing regulatory environment to ensure that people from all walks of life have equal access to the world of crypto.

AGENDA
18:00h - 18:30h: Entrance
18:30h - 18:40h: Introduction
18:40h - 19:00h: CollectID - Authenticity Through Technology - Once and for All
19:00h - 19:10h: Discussion and Q&A
19:10h - 19:30h: Forctis AG - ARES: Towards a Revolution in Asset Representation
19:30h - 19:40h: Discussion and Q&A
19:40h - 19:50h: Break
19:50h - 20:10h: Enabling Accessibility in Discriminative Crypto Markets
19:40h - 21:00h: Get together/Drinks

This meetup will be held in English.

Register Now for Online Data Science Training Free Demo by IIT & IIM Experts at Infogrex.Participants who are aspiring to make a career in this Data Science field must surely attend this Free Online Data Science Demo to showcase skills for career enhancement.

About:
Infogrex in association with Colaberry Inc., USA, offers Data Science training and consulting solutions to MNC’s, government and non-profit organizations in the areas of Business Intelligence & Predictive Analytics using cutting edge technologies and tools.

Most data science aspirants have a lot of questions regarding the domain. We will answer these questions and help you identify an ideal roadmap for starting a career in data science. Attending this workshop will give you exposure to the practical implementation of Data Science and big data in various industries. You will be able to explore the various dimensions of data science along with an understanding of its future scope.

Description:
Data science is the process of analyzing data that involves applying Machine learning models, statistical models to derive insights and value from data. This field is highly evolving as one of the most promising career paths for skilled professionals.

Role of Data Scientist:
The main objective of a data scientist is to organize and analyze large amounts of data, and they often use software designed specifically for that task. The outputs obtained from the analysis of a data scientist should be easy enough for the stakeholders to understand; especially for Non-IT people.

Course Overview:
We are providing Advanced Certification programs in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Python.

Mode of Session:: Online / Offline – Hybrid Learning Model.

Learning Geographies: Mumbai, Bengaluru, Delhi NCR, Chennai, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Pune.

events.name: London Bitcoin Devs 0.17 w/ Andrew Poelstra and James Chiang
London Bitcoin Devs 0.18 w/ Andrew Chow
London Bitcoin Devs 0.19 w/ Tom Trevethan
DSM Bitcoin & Blockchain Meetup: Special Guest - Sir John Hargrave
events.description:
This month, we are pleased to be welcoming John Hargrave.

John is the CEO of Media Shower, publisher of the Bitcoin Market Journal, and author of Blockchain for Everyone.

We're excited to announce that he will be delivering his presentation titled "How to Determine the Value of Crypto Assets: The Blockchain Investor Scorecard."

With the total value of all crypto assets – bitcoin, altcoins, and cryptocurrencies – moving past $250 billion, how do investors place a value on computer code? On technology with no central bank or physical asset to support it? Drawing on his experience from analyzing hundreds of blockchain assets on Bitcoin Market Journal, John will explore the criteria that investors are using to value these new assets.

In addition to his presentation, everyone will receive a free copy of the “Blockchain Investor Scorecard,” an easy-to-use system to evaluate digital assets, from new blockchain tokens to actively traded cryptocurrencies.

You can learn more about John and his work from the following resources:
https://www.mediashower.com/
https://medium.com/@jhargrave
https://www.amazon.com/dp/1982113545/

We hope to see you then!

events.name: Elastos Melbourne
events.description:
RSVP on Elastos Melbourne Meetup Page: https://www.meetup.com/Elastos-Melbourne/events/zwqkxpyxlbcc/

We will be providing a great fun environment for you to learn more about Elastos, blockchain and how it relates to you as an average everyday Aussie.

In particular we'll describe how Elastos creates a more secure, smarter web where you can create digital scarcity for all creatives and you can own your assets so their free from piracy and replication.

Suitable for beginners all the way to blockchain experts. Food and drinks are provided 😋

----
ELASTOS FOUNDATION
----
Elastos is a completely open source, network operating system that utilizes the decentralization of P2P communication (Elastos Carrier) and security of blockchain to create an end-to-end secure web environment for users, internet of things, and all smart devices.

It also creates, for the first time, a space for creatives to build true digital wealth and protect their intellectual property by creating scarcity and true identification of digital content.

Elastos is like a decentralised, upgraded security version of the Windows operating system and is owned by everyone (open sourced), not one company. Elastos focuses on providing a secure infrastructure platform for developers and business people to build useful fast, scalable and secure dApps to interact with any blockchain, using any operating system and device.

It is protocol agnostic which gives dApp developers complete freedom to choose which blockchain protocols they want to use for their dApps.

To learn more: https://medium.com/elastos/elastos-cliff-notes-version-a305e92a7855

events.name: The Need for Governance in Blockchain | TF Portland Chapter Ep 08
events.description:
You Are Invited!

Hello Portland!

TF Blockchain is hosting Episode 8 of our Portland Chapter, Evening Event on December 17, 2019, held at WeWork Labs in Portland.

Event Topic: "The need for Governance in Blockchain"
The Governance behind any company or organization leads to order, plan, and rules for various scenarios which could come up, and Blockchain is no different. As we think through the exchange of value behind participants in a network, who has access to that network, decentralization, immutable ledgers, and more, the need for governance is most evident, yet often the most overlooked aspect at blockchain events and projects themselves. Join us for an interesting discussion Thomas Cox is the Chief Governance Officer at Strong Block

About TF Blockchain:
TF Blockchain is an Events, Media, and Consulting Firm, focused on connecting Blockchain Innovators with enterprise business, technologist, and investors. The TF Blockchain Portland Chapter will provide a community base for engagement, collaboration and advanced education (technical and non-technical) around blockchain; to support overall blockchain growth in Portland. https://tfblock.io/portland

events.name: ZK-TOR 0x01: Introduction to Zero Knowledge Proofs
events.description:
The first ZK Toronto meetup will be a hands-on introduction to zero knowledge proofs. You will learn the basics of zero knowledge proofs and build a simple application using snarkjs and circom.

Agenda:
- 7: 00 pm: Arrival
- 7:10 pm: Zero Knowledge Proof Basics
- 8: 00 pm: Break. Mingle with your fellow peers and ask questions
- 8: 10 pm: Introduction to Snarkjs and Circom through building a SNApp.
- 9: 00 pm: End of event.

The event will be held at the Bahen Institute of Technology at the University of Toronto. The room is BA 1200.

Bring a laptop with the latest version of npm installed and wifi will be provided. If you are affiliated with an institution that has eduroam, you will be able to use your eduroam credentials at UofT.

All of the math required will be presented during the workshop. If you want to brush up on the basic math required, you can read the following:

https://medium.com/@VitalikButerin/quadratic-arithmetic-programs-from-zero-to-hero-f6d558cea649

https://medium.com/@VitalikButerin/exploring-elliptic-curve-pairings-c73c1864e627

https://medium.com/@VitalikButerin/zk-snarks-under-the-hood-b33151a013f6

The workshop will be given by Mikerah. Mikerah is a researcher at HashCloak, a blockchain R&D lab based in Toronto. She works on privacy solutions for blockchains with a current focus on privacy in Proof-of-Stake systems and scalability, with a focus on optimistic rollups.

Thanks to Beam (https://beam.mw/) for sponsoring the event.
events.how_to_find_us: https://twitter.com/ZK_Global

events.name: Are You Ready for the Next Bull Run?
events.description:
It has been more than a year now since we hosted our last meetup. Same as Bitcoin, we are resilient and are resurfacing from a long hiatus. Since last year we have seen the bitcoin ecosystem being accepted by the mainstream organizations, and even countries vying for introducing their own digital currencies. In this event we will be summarizing the events briefly and what to expect next.
As the next halving is nearing (ETA 14 May[masked]:23:36), we want to inform ourselves about its meaning and impact on the cryptocurrency prices.

A brief intro into “Halving”:

Every 4 years on average (210K blocks) the reward granted to Bitcoin miners for adding a block to the blockchain is cut in half. The Bitcoin halving was designed to keep Bitcoin’s inflation in check. If fewer bitcoins are being generated per block mined, the newly increased scarcity automatically makes them more valuable. But this doesn’t happen right away.
Why does Halving affect the price of bitcoin? For that, we need to see the role miners play. About 4,380 blocks are mined each month and added to the bitcoin blockchain. Right now, the block reward is 12.5 BTC, and after the halving event, the block reward will be 6.25 BTC.
When this happens, two scenarios unfold: Miners will simply give up, or they will HODL.
Historically it ends up being a mix of both. Some small number of miners will indeed give up, while the majority will instead choose to keep mining and hold.
The first halving occurred in November 2012, when 1 BTC went for around $11 USD. The following year, the price began to climb dramatically, reaching a new all-time high of over $1,100 in 2013. The price then crashed down to the $220-$240 range, where it would remain for the next few years.
The next halving occurred on July 9, 2016. BTC stayed in the $[masked] range for several months before slowly rising toward the end of the year.

Put in simpler words, it comes down to the principle of supply and demand

The mission of this event is to help our community learn more about the upcoming halving, and weed out the mistakes that were made in 2017. We will hear from past experiences of people, and ways to avoid the pitfalls.

AGENDA

6:30 – 7:00 Intro-networking
7:00- 7:15 Meetup presentation
7:15- 8:00 Panel Discussion (Guests to be announced)
8:00- 8:30 Networking

events.name: Blockchain in Insurance - BLOCKHACK 2019
events.description:
Hyperledger Kochi, the meetup group for Hyperledger community members around Kochi, is associating with Kerala Blockchain Academy for a 24 hour live hackathon that is conducted by Allianz Technology and Kerala Blockchain Academy on December 10-11, 2019.

The theme of the hackathon is "Blockchain in Insurance".

Venue : Integrated Startup Complex, Kerala Technology Innovation Zone, Kalamassery , Kochi.

Registration is FREE.

For more details regarding the hackathon, please visit the website : https://hackathon.blockhash.live/

About the Hackathon : Kerala Blockchain Academy in association with Allianz Technology is conducting a 24 hour live hackathon BlockHack2019 on December 10th -11th, 2019 at Integrated Startup Complex (ISC), Kerala Technology Innovation Zone, Kalamassery, Kochi. This Hackathon is part of BlockHashLive 2019 - the annual Kerala Blockchain Summit, organized by Kerala Blockchain Academy to be held on December[masked] at Kochi. There will be an initial short listing of teams based on the problem description. The theme of this Hackathon is Blockchain in Insurance. The judgement will be delivered by a panel of experts in the domain of Blockchain and Insurance.

Problem Description : In the case of International captive insurance programs managed by Insurance companies, clients operate on a global scale with different geographies, dealing with their local banks, currencies. Let’s say, To take part in such an insurance program, the client “Awesome Company” has set up their own Captive Insurance company with headquarter in Germany and the insurance policy is expected to be renewed with an annual premium of EUR100m. Afterwards, the headquarter is required to collect the premium portions from all the local offices all over the world. This process is extremely human-intensive as it involves cross-border payment, different banks, time zones, languages. How can we leverage Blockchain / DLT to facilitate this global money movement to improve process transparency, data accuracy and data currency?

events.name: Diseño y despliegue de entornos productivos con Hyperledger Fabric
events.description:
La utilización de Hyperledger para el desarrollo de pruebas de concepto presenta un reto en ocasiones muy complejo de abordar, porque el diseño de la infraestructura y el desarrollo de los chaincodes en estos proyectos condicionan el funcionamiento de las soluciones desarrolladas y su uso en entornos reales.

En la sesión presentaremos las principales claves de diseño para implantar entornos realmente productivos con la última versión de Hyperledger Fabric, que proporcionen alta disponibilidad, escalabilidad y alto rendimiento a las soluciones desarrolladas con esta tecnología.

Realizaremos además un ejemplo práctico de despliegue en minutos de una infraestructura completa con Hyperledger Fabric 1.4.3 sobre kubernetes, incluyendo aplicaciones que utilizan las capacidades proporcionadas por este entorno.

Agenda:

18:00 Registro

18:30 Hyperledger Fabric para entornos productivos:

- Arquitectura y funcionamiento de Hyperledger Fabric 1.4.3
- Criterios de diseño y despliegue

19:15 Demo:

- Introducción
- Despliegue de red
- Demostradores: creación de tokens, supply chain, trust explorer

20:15 Networking

Te esperamos el 18 de Diciembre a partir de las 18:00 en el ágora de Wayra, planta 8 del edificio Telefónica de Gran Vía, 28 (la entrada se realizará por la calle de Valverde).

Es muy importante que tengamos tu nombre, dos apellidos y DNI para gestionar tu acceso al edificio, recuerda indicarlo al solicitar tu entrada en el siguiente enlace (IMPRESCINDIBLE OBTENER ENTRADA PARA ASISTIR):

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/diseno-y-despliegue-de-entornos-productivos-con-hyperledger-fabric-tickets-83806540619

Recomendamos que vengas con antelación para gestionar el acceso, y no perderte nada del meetup.

Además, se hará un registro de mochilas y marcado de ordenadores para una mayor seguridad. Para agilizar la acreditación te recomendamos que no lo traigas si puedes evitarlo.

events.name: Workshop: Izzivi nepremičninske industrije v Sloveniji

group.name: Blockchain for Real Estate - FIBREE Slovenia

events.description:
Najprej hvala vsem, ki ste se udeležili minulega jutranjega dogodka. Mislim, da smo vzpostavili dober temelj za nadaljevanje.

O srečanju
------------------------------------
Na našem naslednjem srečanju bomo skupaj poiskali največje izzive znotraj nepremičninske industrije pri nas in po svetu.

Format srečanja bomo zato nekoliko prilagodili, in sicer kot 30 minutni mini workshop, kjer bi naše misli usmerili v t.i. problem-finding.

“The formulation of a problem is often more essential than its solution.”
– Albert Einstein

Ker pa imamo do naslednjega meetup-a še dovolj časa, je tukaj še povezava do zanimivega workbook-a:

https://gallery.mailchimp.com/f3275619a74d5b56ab076b429/files/How_to_Become_a_Creative_Badass_2017_version.pdf

→ Za lažjo organizacijo prosimo za RSVP
→ Prispevek 10€ na osebo za odličen zajtrk in kavo (ali čaj) se poravna pri gostiteljih ob prihodu

Za vsa vprašanja sva na voljo:
------------------------------------
Denis Petrovčič
Board at FIBREE • CEO at Blocksquare

Andrej Lampe, MRICS
Regional Chair at FIBREE • Managing Partner at NAI Significa

Kaj je FIBREE?
------------------------------------
FIBREE je neprofitna organizacija, ki je v minulem letu doživela exponentno rast ter prepoznavnost znotraj t.i. Proptech industrije in je danes prisotna na več kot 55 lokacijah po celem svetu.

Med podporniki FIBREE najdemo uveljavljene organizacije kot so denimo CBRE, DLA Piper, Rabobank in drugi. Njen cilj je globalno povezanti strokovnjake na področju nepremičninske industrije ter blockchain tehnologije.

V letu 2019 je na konferrenci MIPIM Proptech v Parizu FIBREE predstavil prvi svetovni "Blockchain Real Estate Industry Report" v katerem najdete zbrane podatke o več kot 500 produktih iz celega sveta, ki naslavljajo nepremičninsko industrijo.

Celotno poročilo je brezplačno dostopno na spletni strani www.fibree.org

events.name: How & why are blockchain entrepreneurs pursuing privacy offerings?
events.description:
Join Simon Harman & Typehuman to discuss why privacy has become a seminal issue, and what blockchain has to do with it?

About this Event
We're excited to host Simon Harman, CEO of the Loki Project to discuss the forces behind the recent push for privacy technologies & regulations, why web3 and blockchain is important to those innovating in privacy-tech, and what he and the Loki team are up to.
Simon and the Loki team have been building out a blockchain backed technology platform that aims to enable fully anonymous communications. They raised $9m in March 2018 in order to found Loki as Australia's first privacy focused not-for-profit. Since then they have been busy developing their technology, and recently launched their beta messaging apps to both iOS and Android users.
“Loki Messenger allows for truly decentralized, end to end, and private encrypted chats. Loki Messenger is built to handle both online and fully Asynchronous offline messages. Loki Messenger implements the Signal protocol for message encryption. Our Client interface is a fork of Signal Messenger. All communication that passes through Loki messenger is routed through Lokinet.”
SImon is a respected leader among the Australian blockchain community, and it's a real pleasure to have him join us to share his views and experiences.

The evening will be hosted at the Typehuman office, MC'd by Nick Byrne and be a "fireside chat" setting. Please join us for a rich conversation followed by snacks and drinks.

events.name: Cointelligence Academy Community Meetup
events.description:
Knowledge for the community, by the community.
----------
Cointelligence Academy is inviting you to take part in our monthly London meetups, where we will physically gather and talk about the latest developments in the blockchain and cryptocurrency space, share knowledge, and network with like-minded individuals.

We strongly believe that alongside our online crypto education content, each of us can benefit from seeing others face-to-face, sharing ideas over coffee, and hearing what our peers have to say about the latest news in crypto. We’re creating a place where community members can discuss the premise of the latest smart contracts platform to launch, or introduce their favorite new DeFi project. Who knows - this might be where you and your future co-founders meet.

We’re doing this because we feel the need for an objective, non-judgemental, and agenda-free learning environment, which is why we created Cointelligence Academy in the first place.

Just like our online platform, in these meetups we will NOT give you investment advice, try to shill a certain coin or project, or be biased towards one project over another. Instead, we will create a neutral environment where all opinions are welcome and the goal is to discuss and share information so everyone can come to their own conclusions.

We will not be featuring speakers or keynotes at these events, but we still want them to feel organized rather than chaotic. To that end we will source our agendas from our community.
Before each meetup, Cointelligence Academy community members will be able to suggest topics of conversation, on which the entire community can then vote - and the topics that receive the most votes will be prioritized on the topic list.

We are very excited to start seeing faces and talk extensively about our favorite ecosystem, and hope to see you all at the next event.

---------------
This event will be held at WeWork Labs. WeWork Labs opens a vertical-specific equity-free workspace and global platform solely dedicated to FinTech and Blockchain enabled startups. We support early innovators across the ecosystem including companies using DLT technology through finance, supply chain, e-commerce and similar verticals.

Raed A. Masri, a serial Canadian founder & YPO’er (with two 20x outcomes and 3 failures), turned VC and institutional LP.

Raed was partially responsible for introducing new wireless policy, when he founded Jaguar Wireless, a qualified bidder in Canada’s national wireless auction in 2008 with a last bid of $213m. Later, Raed became responsible for bringing inflight internet across Canada when he founded SkySurf, the exclusive carrier for inflight communications, exiting to GoGo Inflight, the world’s largest inflight wi-fi provider.

-Allison Steitz, Investor, BlueRun Ventures

Allison invests in seed and series A stage opportunities in frontier technologies (AI/ML, robotics, blockchain), enterprise saas, and digital health with BlueRun Ventures, a venture capital firm based in the Bay Area. Prior to BRV, Allison worked for Quona Capital, a venture capital firm focused on growth stage financial technology companies in Latin America, South and Southeast Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.

-Yanniv Dorone, Investor, AgFunder; PhD Candidate, Department of Plant Biology, Stanford University; 2019 Forbes 30 Under 30: Science & Healthcare Europe List

In parallel, he is finishing his PhD at Stanford University, where he studies how seeds sense water during germination. His work earned him two prestigious fellowships at Stanford, and he was selected as an American Society of Plant Biologists scholar.

events.name: How to Get Seed Funding for Your Early Stage Startup
events.description:
This event is organized by:

www.idea-to-ipo.com

The deadline to register and pay online is 2 pm the day of the event.

PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

There is a cover charge for this event.

A "YES" RSVP on our meetup site does not confirm your reservation.

Space is limited. Please only RSVP "Yes" if you will be attending.

Take advantage of early responder pricing!

Slots are limited. First come, first served!

First Responders $12 plus Eventbrite fees

Second Responders $15 plus Eventbrite fees

Third Responders $17 plus Eventbrite fees

Fourth Responders $20 plus Eventbrite fees

In order to attend, you must register and pay here:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/how-to-get-seed-funding-for-your-early-stage-startup-tickets-82929009901

Please bring your printed ticket to the event.

Or, pay $25 (cash) at the door.

Stan Lewandowski of K & L Gates will discuss currently available ways for qualified startups to secure seed funding, the instruments issued by the startup to the investors in exchange for the capital provided and the terms associated with each type of an investment.

Stan will cover:

1. Overview of issues you should address before you start seeking seed funding

2. Types of legal entities suitable for your startup needs

3. Initial capitalization for your startup

4. Items to address in your executive summary

5. Should you have a business plan?

6. Most important diligence issues for early stage investors

7. How much capital should you consider raising

8. Persons you should connect with while raising your initial seed funding

9. Platforms for early stage capital raising purposes

10. How to close your initial round of funding

and more!

Please come with your questions, concerns and scenarios.

Agenda

6:30 pm to 7:00 pm Check In, Food, Networking

7:00 pm to 8:30 pm Presentation, Q & A

8:30 pm to 9:00 pm Informal Q & A, Networking

About the Speaker

Stan Lewandowski is a partner at K & L Gates and is based in Palo Alto and San Francisco. Stan counsels companies in the U.S. and abroad on financing, operations, development and other strategic transactional issues, primarily in the technology and renewable energy sectors.

Stan represents emerging growth companies at every stage of the pipeline—from start-up to liquidity. He works on a variety of strategic growth issues, including venture capital and private equity financings, private offerings, joint ventures and M&A.

Combining his experience representing Central and Eastern European companies with his Silicon Valley background, Stan has worked closely with investors and companies on domestic, in-bound and out-bound transactions, as well as on-shore and off-shore structures.

Stan also has significant experience advising developers, their affiliates and investors, and financial institutions in connection with the development and disposition of renewable energy projects, with a total value in the hundreds of millions of dollars.

Stan earned his LL.M. from the University of California, Hastings College of the Law. He received his master of laws and diploma from Nicolaus Copernicus University in Poland. He also earned a diploma from the University of Cambridge in England.

If you have questions about the content of this presentation, you can contact Stan at:

[masked]

events.name: Decred Special Interest Group

group.name: Philadelphia Technology for Blockchain and Cryptocurrency

events.description:
This is a recurring event for individuals interested in Decred. Decred offers an interesting technology for learning about blockchain and cryptocurrency technology. The group is run by Michael Ghen, an active researcher studying Decred's technology and engineer running full nodes on Decred's testnet.

# What is Decred?

Decred is a decentralized, autonomous digital currency governed directly by its voting stakeholders. Stakeholders vote to decide on consensus rule changes, as well as matters of Treasury and policy. Decred is self-funded by a portion of the block

# Why is Decred needed?

Decred was born from its founders’ experiences with Bitcoin’s governance. Company 0 developed a Bitcoin full node implementation called btcsuite, but the software was not well received by the Bitcoin Core development team. With Bitcoin, the Core developers and Proof-of-Work miners are strong, centralized constituencies that can effectively veto changes to the consensus rules — other stakeholders in the Bitcoin ecosystem have minimal influence. The absence of a clear method for making decisions results in protracted disputes and chain splits, whereby a sub-community breaks off and creates an alternative version of the currency. This weakens the network effects and dilutes the project’s resources. Bitcoin also has a funding problem, which has been addressed with venture capital investment, bringing with it conflicts of interest. Decred is a better cryptocurrency because it addresses these shortcomings.

Learn more: https://decred.org/brief/
