events.name: Blockchain Startup Pitches - Zurich
events.description:
Decentralization, blockchain, distributed ledgers, and crypto assets are all over the tech news. Meetings and conferences in New York and Hong Kong make us forget easily how decentralized the future of technology is. After all, great innovations can happen anywhere! This event brings together the Zurich blockchain community and those interested in the topic. 2-3 Blockchain startups from Zurich will give short presentations about their vision for the future - followed by drinks and a get-together.

This event is sponsored by BLOCKROCKET (blockrocket.io) - European Blockchain Labs. BLOCKROCKET supports and helps accelerate blockchain startups in launching and growing their business model by providing a platform based on top level co-working facilities in Frankfurt, Munich, and Berlin and connecting them to stakeholders relevant for their startups.

We would also like to thank our partners - Azure Blockchain Zurich (https://www.meetup.com/Azure-Blockchain-Zurich/) and DigiComp Academy AG (https://www.digicomp.ch/) for supporting us and for collaborating with us on this event.

TICKETS
++++ The meetup is free of charge but there is a limited number of seats. Therefore, please RSVP your free spot on Eventbrite. This is important since you can only join the meetup with a valid Eventbrite ticket https://www.eventbrite.de/e/blockchain-startup-pitches-zurich-tickets-67785838267++++

TOPIC
Disrupt Meetup | Blockchain Startup Pitches - Zurich

SPEAKERS
Here is the current line-up of the upcoming speakers:

(1) David Geisser, Founder and CEO, CollectID (https://collectid.io)
David holds a Master’s degree in Business Innovation from the University of St. Gallen, where he did a one year program in Design Thinking in collaboration with Stanford University. As part of the program, he developed an MVP for a Swiss-based retail bank. After his studies, David joined Boydak Strategy Consulting where he focused on business model innovation and rapid prototyping. During this time, David led several projects and developed various MVPs for different clients.

(2) Eduardo Salazar, CEO, Forctis AG (https://forctis.io)
An economist engaged in macro-econometrics and applied mathematics, but perhaps more of a technologist on a daily basis, for over 30 years Eduardo has followed a career path involving broadly engaging, cross-disciplinary environments. His experience spans both academia and the private sector, as well as work for multilateral organizations such as the World Bank and the IADB.

(3) Nathan Worsley, Co-Founder and CTO, LocalCoinSwap (https://localcoinswap.com/en/)

Nathan Worsley is the Co-founder and Chief Technical Officer of LocalCoinSwap. In 2015 he founded the LocalCoinSwap project and was the first developer on the codebase. Although working full time on a technical startup, Nathan's educational background is in Economics and machine learning. Nathan has a passion for using Blockchain as a tool for promoting financial inclusivity. This passion has driven the LocalCoinSwap project to adapt and pivot in the ever-changing regulatory environment to ensure that people from all walks of life have equal access to the world of crypto.

AGENDA
18:00h - 18:30h: Entrance
18:30h - 18:40h: Introduction
18:40h - 19:00h: CollectID - Authenticity Through Technology - Once and for All
19:00h - 19:10h: Discussion and Q&A

19:30h - 19:40h: Discussion and Q&A

19:40h - 21:00h: Get together/Drinks

Crypto-Assets Capital Markets- Fundamental and Technical Overview" (Jai): Learn general overview of fundamental and technical analysis and how it correlates to the markets. Tracking macro-market sentiment and common trading setups.

How does this impact Blockchain Technology?

Space is very limited. Please RSVP asap.

We look forward to seeing you!

675 Ponce De Leon Ave NE W207, Atlanta, GA 30308

events.name: Blockchain Timestamps & Legal Enforcement @ Lisk Center Utrecht
events.description:
BCNL welcomes you at Lisk Center Utrecht for a meetup event about the topics 'Blockchain Timestamps & Legal Enforcement'!

Timestamping documents and content; it could sound somewhat boring, but logically it will be the first phase of mass adoption in crypto. What does our Dutch ecosystem bring to the table when it comes to this potential use-case for mass adoption? And how do blockchain timestamps stand up in court?

We have three angels in the house: a KYC’ed document timestamp start-up, v-ID, the totally open-content timestamp start-up WordProof. After their three short talks, we end with an AMA x Panel Discussion based on a statement every speaker ends their talk with.

events.name: Blockchain In The Burgh Meetup
events.description:
We are doing something a little bit different for this meetup. We will have a panel which will be moderated by Laura. Josh M. and Alex Sherbuck will be our technical experts, Jin Vise and Josh will represent project leaders and Rebecca will be on hand as a community leader.

In the next few days I will post short bio's about each of us. Start thinking of questions that you would like us to answer. We will send out an email to gather the questions prior to the meetup.

More details to follow soon!!!

Moderator
Laura T - DGBAT core team , co-founder of Blockchain in the Burgh meetup, promotor of blockchain education.

Panel
Jin Vise - CoFounder @changeangel_io, DGBAT Core Member

Josh Inthecity - Project and community lead for PotCoin, one of the first 20 cryptocurrencies ever in existence. Originally created in 2013 to solve the banking issue for the legal cannabis industry, PotCoin was originally thought of as an experiment.
* Josh's background as an entrepreneur goes back to his roots in the music industry, where he spent years touring, owning recording studios, consulting, judging events and working with organisations who give grants to aspiring artists.
*After being introduced to Bitcoin through a client in the early years, he was very skeptical of its use and value, until learning about decentralization.
Today he spends every waking moment trying to make the world better by raising his kids, increasing awareness of crypto & its ability to give the power back to the people.

Josh M. - Creator of blockchain tutorials, to explain bitcoin, blockchain, and all things cryptocurrency for everyone

Alex Sherbuck - "Blockchain for Normies"

Rebecca White - In 2015, Rebecca's son sent her five dollars’ worth of Bitcoin and she read the Satoshi Nakamoto Bitcoin White Paper; there has been no looking back since. Rebecca is a Crypto-Enthusiast that focuses on the adoption of Litecoin as a permissionless, borderless, trustless, decentralized, censorship resistant, immutable, secure form of payment.
Rebecca is the co-founder of “Blockchain in the Burgh” monthly meetup, a Coordinator for the Crypto Campfire Podcast, and a Litecoin Foundation Volunteer.

We are in the CoLab18 Classroom inside of Nova Place.

We would like to aim to start at 6:15PM since we need to vacate the room by 7:30PM. Looking forward to seeing everyone!

Please RSVP as we have space available for 60 people.

events.name: Enabling Constraints
events.description:
'Enabling Constraints' is a key concept in the Cynefin approach to complexity. Our last meetup on using Cynefin and TOC generated a lot of questions and comments. In our next meetup, we'll discuss further the concept of constraints with a particular focus on the differences and similarities of both 'Enabling Constraints' and 'Governing Constraints'. We've included some resources that we recommend you look over from Alicia Juarrero, as well as some articles that will provide plenty of background. See you then.

Doors open at 5:45. We will start at exactly 6:15 pm

VIDEOS:
* Alicia Juarrero: Constraints that Enable Innovation - https://vimeo.com/128934608

* Alicia Juarero - Keynote: Think Safe-fail to thrive under conditions of uncertainty - https://vimeo.com/143055623

ARTICLES:
* http://si-new.jenal.org/category/foundations/cas/

* Dave Snowden Blog: Freedom through Constraints - https://cognitive-edge.com/blog/freedom-through-constraints/

* https://theitriskmanager.com/2018/12/09/constraints-that-enable/

BOOKS:
* Dynamics in Action: Intentional Behavior as a Complex System - https://www.amazon.com/Dynamics-Action-Intentional-Behavior-Complex/dp/0262600471

ABOUT OUR HOSTS
Everything ShopKeep does supports growing and independent businesses. Built by and for small business owners, ShopKeep provides an intuitive, secure, tablet-to-cloud point of sale and payments processing platform with POS software that empowers merchants to run smarter businesses by optimizing staffing, managing inventory and accessing real-time sales reports and customer information on one seamless, cloud-based system. With more than 25,000 customers, ShopKeep’s award-winning customer care team is available to help 24/7 and provides a robust support network for growing business owners. ShopKeep is headquartered in New York City, with offices in Portland (OR), Chicago (IL), and Belfast (NIR).

Follow @ShopKeepTech (https://twitter.com/shopkeeptech) on Twitter, join the discussion on the ShopKeep blog (https://www.shopkeep.com/blog), or visit www.ShopKeep.com to learn more about ShopKeep’s POS system.

events.name: Fabric 2.0 Workshop
events.description:
Join us to learn about Fabric 2.0, which introduces decentralized governance for chaincode.

This workshop is going to be led by Jorge D. Rodriguez, a Senior Technical Staff Member and Solutions Architect at IBM. He received a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Puerto Rico, Mayagüez. Jorge has over 20 years of experience developing enterprise applications in the area of System Management, Cloud Technologies, micro-services and blockchain. Jorge is based in New York City where he has worked as a Blockchain Solutions Architect helping IBM clients understand Blockchain technology and developing solutions on top of the IBM Blockchain Platform. Jorge is a Certified Hyperledger Fabric Administrator and for the last three years he has been architecting blockchain solutions for production environments, leveraging the technology to implement a variety of use cases across different industries and developing best practices for Hyperledger Fabric applications.

AGENDA:
6:00 ~ Guests Arrive

events.name: Trust-Less 2020 Summit | Build A Staking-As-A-Service (PoS Mining) Startup

group.name: Dystopia Labs Los Angeles | Blockchain Workshops

events.description:
The Opportunity Is Like Getting Into Bitcoin Mining Back In 2009.

OUR THESIS:
This is one of those pivotal moments in blockchain history. With ETH 2.0 & multiple PoS layer-1 blockchain protocols slated to launch early 2020, it's an opportunity for developers & students to enter the blockchain space & learn how to build one of the few business models that can earn money: staking-as-a-service (ie. PoS Mining).

SPEAKERS:
- Preston Van Loon (ETH 2.0 Developer; Co-Founder of Prysmatic Labs)
- Marek Olszewski (Co-Founder of Celo)
- Joe Petrowski (Research at Parity / Polkadot)
- Benedict Chan (CTO of BitGo)
- Adrian Brink (Co-Founder of Cryptium Labs)
- Tom Schmidt (Product at 0x)
- Luke Youngblood (CEO of Blockscale; Exec at Coinbase Custody)
- Shehan Chandrasekera (Head of Tax Strategy at Cointracker)
- Collin Myers (Global DeFi Product Strategy at Codefi Networks (ConsenSys))
- Tim Ogilvie (CEO of Staked)
- Richard Li (COO of Certus.One)
- and more!

See the entire lineup here:
http://trust-less-2020.dystopialabs.com/

Attendees Will Learn:
- What The ETH 2.0 Roadmap Looks Like + How Staking Will Work
- How To Build Your Own Staking-As-A-Service Startup
- Staking-As-A-Service Models: Economics, Custody, & Security
- Frameworks For Treasury Management
- How To Think Through Crypto-Taxes
- How To Stake On Different Layer-1 Blockchain Networks
- and more!

This Is A Virtual & IRL Conference:
The conference is virtual (and 100% free), so you'll be able to tune in from anywhere in the world. The speakers have 30min to speak.The audience can interact with the speaker and ask questions (there is a 15-30min Q/A slot per speaker). However, we will be having IRL kick-offs & viewing parties in a few cities (venue will be disclosed at a later date).

****IMPORTANT: Due to video bandwidth issues, there actually will be limited spots (so we can make sure things won't crash). So in all seriousness, please don't wait till the last second to sign up. Make sure to claim your ticket asap (on Eventbrite) to reserve your spot:

events.name: Community Currencies - Die Idee und laufende Projekte
events.description:
Das Jahr 2019 ist kaum vorbei und wir starten wieder durch in 2020 mit dem Thema "Community Currencies". Vielen Dank an Ronald für seine Initiative das Thema hier in Mainz näher zu verstehen und zu von konkreten Projekten etwas zu lernen.

Eine eigene Währung für Deine Stadt? Das nicht ganz neu, aber mit der Blockchain-Technologie entstehen jetzt ganz neue Möglichkeiten. Es tut sich viel in diesem spannenden Feld der Blockchain-Szene. Im Meetup geben wir Dir einen Überblick und die Möglichkeit, zwei Projekte näher kennen zu lernen.

Zum Einstieg geben wir Euch einen Überblick über unterschiedliche Ansätze und Erfolgsbedingungen von Blockchain-basierte Gemeinschaftswährungen (Community Currencies).

Dann stellen sich zwei Projekte vor:

1.) Coinsence Projekt
ist eine dezentrale Plattform zur Förderung von Zusammenarbeit in einer Geme inschaft. Mit Hilfe einer Blockchain erhält jeder Teilnehmer einen Anteil der Gemeinschaftswährung, die in Projekte investiert und gegen Leistungen und Güter eingetauscht werden können. Coinsence wird derzeit in Tunesien pilotiert.

2.) Trustlines Projekt
Trustlines ist eine Blockchain-Lösung, mit der Geldbeträge zwischen Menschen, die sich vertrauen, abgerechnet werden können. Durch die Blockchain entsteht daraus ein Vertrauensnetz, durch das die finanzielle und wirtschaftliche Integration von Menschen gefördert werden kann.

Wie immer gibt es genug Zeit für Fragen und Diskussionen.

Grüße,
Ronald, Nhan, Krystian & Felix

events.description:
Join us at our discussion group we are calling 'Frank's Complexity Lounge".

We continuously operate in (and are) Complex systems, yet few of us take the time to understand what this means. Our group discusses a wide range of topics viewed through the lens of Complexity Theory, with a focus on how a deeper understanding of Complexity and Complex Systems can be applied to our work and daily lives.

We meet weekly in the Downtown Brooklyn area every Tuesday from 6:00 - 8:00 pm at 'Franks Lounge' - a short walk from BAM and Barclay Center.

We are one block from virtually every subway line you can think of!

events.name: SBM vol. #15 - BIP324 oraz BIP150 - Bartłomiej (Tony) Sanak
events.description:
Silesia Blockchain Meetup są to spotkania mające na celu integrację środowiska pasjonatów technologii blockchain oraz edukowanie poprzez zapraszanie ekspertów w swoich dziedzinach. Kto był ten wie.

Bartłomiej (Tony) Sanak jest programistą oraz fanem Bitcoina jako środka do osiągnięcia anonimowości w płatnościach. Na co dzień pracuje w firmie zajmującej się analityką w sieci Bitcoin, w szczególności wykrywaniem nielegalnych aktywności używających Bitcoina. Po pracy zmienia strony i interesuje się systemami anonimizacji transakcji oraz skalowalnością Bitcoina (LightningNetwork). Bartłomiej jest także guest-writerem dla BitcoinMagazine, pisze o tematyce technologii. Na co dzień mieszka w Vancouver i udziela się w lokalnych grupach promujących Bitcoina, w przeszłości co-organizował Crypto@Cracow meetup.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/SanakTony
Youtube: https://youtube.com/channel/UC1rMoMdDtHTXXfRg_iR-QJQ

Agenda:
Anonimowość - Czy jej brak w Bitcoinie?
Poruszymy braki w anonimowości sieci Bitcoin, jak najłatwiej przeprowadzić "atak" by znaleźć dodatkowe informacje o transakcjach i użytkownikach. Czy developerzy Bitcoina starają się zapobiec tym atakom, i w jaki sposób? Porozmawiamy o kilku propozycjach i sposobach przywrócenia anonimowości, jak
-BIP324 - kodowanie wiadomości na warstwie P2P
-BIP150 - autentykacja połączeń P2P
-Dandelion - jak sprawić by transakcje zakwitły?
-Coinjoin (zerolink) - w jaki sposób wysyłać transakcje by nie narazić się na stratę prywatności
-SNICKER - mixowanie coinów bez interakcji?

Linki:
https://bitcoinmagazine.com/articles/snicker-how-alice-and-bob-can-mix-bitcoin-with-no-interaction
https://bitcoinmagazine.com/articles/bip-324-a-message-transport-protocol-that-could-protect-bitcoin-peers
https://bitcoinmagazine.com/articles/anatomy-anonymity-how-dandelion-could-make-bitcoin-more-private
https://bitcoinmagazine.com/articles/nopara73-on-wasabi-wallet-and-the-quest-for-bitcoin-privacy

Prośba!
0. Jeśli zamierzasz przyjść proszę o rejestrację na meetup.com (NIE Facebook), jeśli z jakichś powodów potrzebujesz się ze mną skontaktować proszę NIE piszcie do mnie na Facebook. Do kontaktu ze mną polecam meetup.com - oraz rejestrację na wydarzenia za pomocą meetup.com
1. Jeśli widzisz wartość w spotkaniach podeślij proszę parę satoshi/BEAM: https://github.com/TomaszWaszczyk/silesia-blockchain-meetup/blob/master/Inne/support.txt

Bardzo dobry koncert Olgi Scheps: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2bFo65szAP0 ;-)

Do zobaczenia,
Tomasz Waszczyk

events.name: Liquidity of Blockchain and Crypto | TF San Antonio Chapter Event at Geekdom
events.description:
Growing the San Antonio Blockchain, Crypto, & Bitcoin community through educational events, panels, fireside chats, and facilitated networking is our goal.

In this fireside chat, we are hosting Phil Geiger from Unchained Capital. Phil is the Director of Product Marketing.

Unchained Capital located in Austin, Texas, is a new kind of financial services company. They lend cash to long-term crypto holders who need liquidity but don't want to sell their coin. Unchained was founded by people who believe that cryptocurrencies have the potential to change the world but only if they're useful.

We start at 5:30PM with open networking and end at 8:00PM

events.name: The Future of Blockchain: Insights from IOTA & GBA

venue.name: London School of Economics and Political Science

events.description:
Want to get insights on the challenges, advancements and vision from two institutions crafting the future of blockchain/ DLT? Join us, the 11th of December for a captivating and insightful evening.

Speakers:

- Michele Nati (Lead Tech Analyst, IOTA) will acquaint us with the solutions and technology IOTA is building, and expand on the technology and research challenges they face. In addition, opportunities to engage with work of the IOTA foundation will be presented.

IOTA's vision is to enable all connected devices through verification of truth and transactional settlements which incentivise devices to make available its properties and data in real time. This will give birth to entirely new general purpose applications and value chains.
About IOTA: www.iota.org

- Richard Hallewell (Vice President, GBA) will share his vision for GBA and their launch of GBA UK.

Government Blockchain Association (GBA) promotes blockchain technologies by empowering individuals and organizations to connect, communicate, and collaborate to solve public sector challenges around the world.
About GBA www.gbaglobal.org

Location:
LSE: New Academic Building, Room 2.04 (NAB.2.04)

Time and Date:
6.30pm - 8.00pm, 11th December 2019

(8.15pm onwards - networking local pub)

Web scraping involves retrieving and parsing information from the Internet. This skill valuable data science skill is used by marketers, stock traders, developers, analysts, and so many more. Automating data extraction from websites can save time, energy, and effort.

Who This Class is For:
Data scientist, analysts, statisticians, business professionals, and developers who want to retrieve and analyze web data. Learning to scrape websites to automatically extract data can save a huge amount of time and effort.

What You’ll Learn:
This web scraping 101 class will teach you how to scrape websites for the data and select parts that you want to analyze. You will also get an introduction on how to format and analyze the data.

Topics Covered:

Recap of Python basics
BeautifulSoup parsing
Matplotlib
Data table formatting
Scraping Rules
Inspecting the Page
Basic HTML
Data Analysis in Python
Pandas library
NumPy library
Exporting data to CSV file
Requirements:

Python Novice skills

Business and Wealth Mastery 2020

This event is for anyone who is seriously looking to change their life for the better in 2020. Maybe you:

1) Want to earn a good second income without having to get a second job

2) Break free from the 9-5 and start their own business

3) Create a time and money freedom laptop lifestyle

4) Learn a new skill that will allow you to enter the world of trading

5) Simply want a better life than the one you’re living

We live in uncertain times. New technology, changes in global economics and the loss of jobs in many industries and professions are affecting us all and our ability to earn money. This will only get worse as new ways of automating and outsourcing jobs accelerates.

The reality is, business and the way we earn money has changed, forever. One of the most successful businesses in the world was built from a college dorm room and another was built from a shed! Uber own no taxis, AirBnb no accommodation!

It’s not all doom and gloom though! These changes and advances in technology have also given us the greatest opportunity ever to create wealth, if we know how. But we must act and adapt NOW before it’s too late!

It’s essential we learn new 21st century skills so we can engage in the emerging world of e-commerce Information age. There are many ways to do this which will not only allow us to survive but thrive and prosper.

We simply need the right mentorship, education, tools and knowledge.

This allows us to create a lifestyle that many dream of but few rarely achieve. We truly can have all the money and freedom we all desire if we are willing to take action, take a risk and make the decision to try something new!!

At our Business and Wealth Mastery, we will show you how to

1) Start a successful online business

2) Trade profitably in the world’s largest financial market

3) Achiece success in all areas of your life

You will be learning directly from special guest speakers who have achieved major success in trading, business and wealth acquisition online. They will be sharing their expert knowledge and experience so you can eliminate years of trial and error!

events.name: Blockchain and Donations, Campaigns, and Charities (Arlington, VA) – Free Event
events.description:
People love donating, but trust is at an all-time low. This trillion-dollar industry is plagued with scandal and rampant irresponsible spending. Sometimes, as little as 3% of a donation supports the cause it was intended for.
The result: Everybody Loses. The needy are deprived of funds, organizations lack the resources to make a significant impact, legitimate organizations are given a bad name and donors stop giving.
The Blockchain allows organizations to safely receive donations without the need for a centralized intermediary such as a bank. This lowers fees and allows organizations to accept both real (fiat) and digital (crypto) currencies.

GBA member organizations that are using blockchain technology to solve these problems are listed at www.gbaglobal.org/organizations/categories/donations

Come and connect, communicate and collaborate with other blockchain professionals as we promote charitable giving by increasing trust, reducing barriers and build more compassionate and just communities.
5:30 PM to 6:30 PM – Strategic Planning Discussion (GBA Members Only)
6:30 PM to 7:15 PM – Networking (Public)
7:15 PM to 8:15 PM – Presentation (Public)
8:15 PM to Closing – Networking (Public)

events.name: CryptoMondays London
events.description:
What we'll do:
Like-minded people, who are passionate about Crypto, gathering to share their views and network with the goal of strengthening their local Crypto communities.

This month for our Holiday Edition we welcome Yannis Stamelakos! Yannis is a blockchain engineer at Monolith. Monolith is a non-custodial banking replacement, offering the first and only non-custodial wallet paired with a Visa debit card that allows users to spend Ether and ERC20 tokens worldwide.
Yannis holds a Ph.D in low-power, manycore computer architectures which led to a natural progression into blockchain oracles powered by on-chain verifiable cryptographic proofs generated on hardware wallets.

Yannis will be giving a talk entitled:
"From Dumb Contracts to Smart Wallets"
which will detail the evolution of crypto wallets and the revolutionary role of smart contract wallets. This is a very hot topic right now with all of the interest in De-Fi and I am excited to hear from such an experienced developer!

Since this will be our last CryptoMonday of 2019, we will be celebrating the festive season with mince pies and some lovely seasonal drinks. Holiday cheer welcome :)

Drinks and nibbles provided as usual.
Can't wait to see you there!

Massive THANK YOU to our sponsors:
ConsenSys for the venue and
Hydrogen Group for the drinks!

events.name: Konferencja Blockchain i Finanse

venue.name: MsMermaid – Conference Center at The Tides

events.description:
Konferencja Blockchain i Finanse odbędzie się 17 stycznia 2020 w Warszawie w centrum konferencyjnym MsMermaid Center at The Tides. Głównym celem wydarzenia jest budowanie relacji pomiędzy podmiotami z branży finansowej oraz blockchain i kryptowalut. W programie dnia znalazło się kilka interesujących części.

Konferencja i prelegenci
W przestrzeni MsMermaid Center at The Tides zostaną ustawione dwie sceny – Blockchain i Finanse. Pozwoli to na indywidualny dobór wystąpień, które będziemy chcieli wysłuchać. Na każdej ze scen odbędzie się 11 prelekcji oraz 3 panele dyskusyjne.

Wśród potwierdzonych prelegentów sceny Finanse znajdziemy takie nazwiska jak: Rafał Zaorski, Łukasz Zgiep (Beesfund), Bolesław Wójtowicz (Bogaty.man), Sławomir Muturi (fridomia.pl), Przemysław Słomski (slomski.us), Krzysztof Wojczal (krzysztofwojczal.pl) czy Paweł Bilnicki (zarobmy.se).

Na scenie Blockchain wystąpią z kolei: Krzysztof Piech, Marek Kirejczyk (ETH Works), Piotr Włodarek , Jacek Czarnecki (MakerDAO), Tomasz Drwięga (ETH Parity), Artur Kuczmowski (Kancelaria Thompson&Stein) czy dobrze znany, jeden z naszych redaktorów – Stokarz.

Gala Nexus 2019 i występ kabaretowy
Na koniec konferencji Blockchain i Finanse będzie miało miejsce rozdanie nagród branżowych Nexus 2019. Tak jak przed rokiem, nagrodzone zostaną wyróżniające się osoby oraz projekty z branży Blockchain i kryptowalut. Dodatkowo przyznane zostaną nagrody dla najlepszych wystąpień z poszczególnych scen. Galę rozdania nagród uświetni występ satyryka Andrzeja Poniedzielskiego.

Bilety
Bilety na konferencję Blockchain i Finanse dostępne są w kilku wariantach cenowych. Bilet normalny upoważnia nas do wejścia na konferencję i uczestnictwo w niej przez cały dzień. Możemy kupić też bilet normalny rozszerzony o uczestnictwo w gali rozdania nagród Nexus 2019 wraz z występem kabaretowym. Dostępne są również bilety VIP. W ich cenie poza uczestnictwem w konferencji mamy zapewniony dostęp do strefy VIP, a w niej poczęstunek, całodzienny catering VIP, spotkania z prelegentami oraz zarezerwowane miejsca w pierwszych rzędach podczas gali. W pierwszej turze sprzedaży bilety normalne kupimy za 100 zł netto, normalny rozszerzony o galę za 200 zł netto, a bilet VIP za 700 zł netto. Ceny biletów będą rosły wraz ze zbliżaniem się terminu konferencji. Obecne, promocyjne ceny obowiązują do 17 grudnia.

Szczegółowe informacje o konferencji oraz cenach biletów znajdują się na stronie wydarzenia: https://kbif.pl/ Nie zwlekaj, kup bilety już dziś!

events.name: (paid) Online AI course: Deep learning for developers
events.description:
We are starting the new session for the popular 4-week AI course: Deep Learning for Developers.
This course is online live course. You can listen, watch, interact, Q&A with instructors from anywhere around the world. Miss the live session due to time zone or conflict? learn session replay at any time afterwards.

Start date: Jan. 7, 10am PT (US pacific time, check your local time zone).
* 8 sessions, 16 hours
* 10 live lectures, 16 hands-on code labs.
* Live Sessions, Real time interaction
* Forum supports to projects and homeworks

Enrollment:
https://learn.xnextcon.com/course/coursedetails/C20010710

Details:
learn deep learning by building deep learning models and projects.
The course takes unique project focused approach to teach you deep learning by building deep learning models. The instructor will walk you through a series of curated projects, and explain the key concepts as they arise. Students will learn the theory and how these models work under the hood while writing code, and building neural networks.

The course balances learning theory, working on projects, and also hearing from guest speakers who are industry practitioners in the field.

Students who take this course will be able to:
* Identify and frame problems that can be solved by deep learning
* Choose the right techniques to the problems
* Understand key deep learning concepts and how deep learning models work
* Identify and fix problems with messy datasets
* Build deep neural nets for classification and regression using the Keras framework
* Build convolutional neural networks for image classification, object localization and segmentation using the Keras
* Discuss the parts and processes involved in building large scale deep learning applications

Online AI tech talks, courses, bootcamps : https://learn.xnextcon.com

events.name: CryptoMondays London
events.description:
What we'll do:
Like-minded people, who are passionate about Crypto, gathering to share their views and network with the goal of strengthening their local Crypto communities.

In January we are very pleased to welcome as a speaker Nick Fulton, Head of Partnerships at Paybase, an end-to-end solution for Payments, Compliance and Risk. Paybase clients include European platform businesses particularly in the gig, supply chain and blockchain spaces.
Nick will be speaking on the subject of “Network effects and blockchains: what can blockchain businesses learn from Deliveroo, Craigslist and Uber”.

Could a business using the blockchain technology like Ripple or BeefChain learn from a platform like Deliveroo? Actually, it could, according to Nick. They are both aligned on their reliance on strong network effects, a critical requirement for either to succeed. Features like escrow and smart, frictionless transactions are effective strategies used by platform businesses - and they can be key to a blockchain business reaching its disruptive potential.

Nick is particularly interested in nurturing network effects, reducing disintermediation across platforms and hearing about the platform businesses of tomorrow. Paybase are the only provider in Europe to simultaneously allow their clients to build compliant escrow flows and to execute card-to-worker bank account payments in under 30 seconds, providing a true cashless transaction experience for gig economy platforms.

Drinks and nibbles provided as usual.
Can't wait to see you there!

Massive THANK YOU to our sponsors:
ConsenSys for the venue and
Hydrogen Group for the drinks!

events.name: SPECIAL EVENT: Interactive Privacy Lab with BEACON
events.description:
Are we all unpaid employees of Facebook, Google, and Tesla? Probably. Companies are using *our data* to create massive profits.
How can we protect and share in the profits of our data in the world of big tech? How can we "Own our data"?

Joe Toscano of the Better Ethics and Consumer Outcomes Network (BEACON) leads us in an interactive learning experience on data privacy.

BEACON 's purpose is to create a better future, through technology by translating technology's ethical dilemmas into positive-sum business solutions—outcomes that work both for consumers and the companies’ bottom line.

Learn more about BEACON: https://www.beacontrustnetwork.com/

Agenda
5:30-6:00 Networking / Food
6:00-7:30 Interactive Privacy Lab with Joe Toscano
7:30-7:45 Break / Food
7:45-8:15 Fireside Chat: Data, Privacy, and Education | Q&A
8:15-8:30 Networking / Food

About The Workshop:
Is privacy on the internet dead? This experience will engage audience members with an interactive conversation surrounding the current state of privacy that will enable them to have a voice in shaping the future of privacy regulation. The outcome of this workshop will be a mini policy whitepaper bringing the public's voice to policymakers' desks, as well as a unique digital platform for participants to remain engaged with the process post-workshop.

This event is being held in partnership with Learning Experience Design CO: http://meetu.ps/c/3sCmP/5g3yb/a (registration through either meetup will secure your spot).
events.how_to_find_us: There will be a sign at the door to point you in the right direction!

events.name: Coinscrum_markets :: Scaling Tokenised Securities – Reg vs Tech
events.description:
What are the main challenges facing Tokenised Securities?

For our next instalment of Coinscrum_markets, in partnership with Blockchain.com, we take a closer look at a topic that’s garnered much attention over the past year or two.

On the surface, using blockchain/DLT to simplify and disrupt what some might say are outdated Clearing & Settlement systems that underlay existing equities markets makes a lot of sense.

However, technology is just one facet of these highly regulated markets and the likes of the SEC and FCA have wasted no time in pointing out that their existing regulations are going nowhere fast and will still apply – whatever colour your shiny new blockchain might be.

Nevertheless, a number of companies and projects have started to emerge (unfazed) to start tackling these issues head on but, as we know, technologies tend to evolve at light speed whilst regulations often move at a somewhat glacial pace.

With all this in mind, we’ll be taking a close look at both sides of this particular coin to discuss the impact of each on the other.

-
What shackles do existing regulations place on Tokenised Securities and at what cost?
-
How are blockchain/DLT solutions confronting these issue?
-
How do we prevent innovation being stifled by regulations that aren’t custom designed for this use-case?
-
How will regulators need to co-ordinate if they’re to allow the innovation that they often claim to support to occur?

---

Joining us to share their insights and vast experience on these matters will be Graham Rodford & Kathleen Tyson.

About Graham

Graham is Founder & CEO at Archax, a London-based startup aiming to be the first Securitised Token Exchange to be regulated by the FCA. A qualified accountant with over 18 years’ experience in financial services, prior to starting work on Archax, Graham was COO, CCO and Partner of Omni Partners, a $1.4billion hedge fund based in London, where he was responsible for all operational activities and compliance.

About Kathleen

Kathleen Tyson is chief executive of Granularity, a specialist consultancy in financial infrastructure. She is a former central banker and markets supervisor. Her contributions include tri-party repo, the first global real-time margin and collateral system, CLS Bank for global FX settlements, modernisation of central banks and clearinghouses, and much of the initial markets framework for Dubai International Financial Centre.
---

Thanks to Blockchain.com

Blockchain.com is connecting the world to the future of finance. We are one of the most trusted and fastest growing digital assets company, helping millions across the globe – from individuals to the largest institutions – get easy and safe access to digital assets. Blockchain has raised over $70 million in funding from leading investors including Lightspeed Venture Partners, Google Ventures and Richard Branson.

With almost 40 million sign ups, the Blockchain.com wallet helps more people than any other company send, receive, secure and exchange crypto all on chain.

---

Big love to Coinscrum_presents sponsors, KR1
KR1 is a leading publicly listed investment company focused on blockchain and decentralised technologies. KR1 invests in early stage projects and blockchain-based digital assets that power the decentralised platforms and protocols that form the emerging Web3 infrastructure.

More info at www.kr1.io

---

That boring legal stuff
Please note: We welcome all of our innovative founders to share their ideas at Coinscrum and also love our sponsors to bits.

However, their presentations or services provided do not infer any kind of endorsement by Coinscrum, its organisers or Scrumline Ltd of any possible investment opportunity via their products and services or in any related ICO (Initial Coin Offering).

Crypto-tokens are a high risk investment and you should always carry out your own thorough research and due diligence before deciding whether or not to invest yourself.

---

events.name: Women in Blockchain Talks - with Mia Mohamed & Victoria Clarke

group.name: Women in Blockchain London Networking Event

events.description:
****PLEASE GO HERE - http://bit.ly/2KI8pX2 - TO BOOK YOUR TICKET***

Women in Blockchain Talks networking event is back for 2020! And at a new location - ConsenSys in Shoreditch!

Our guests are dynamic women sharing their knowledge, thoughts, and insights on their Blockchain and Tech journey! Come and be inspire as well as motivated into action!

Blockchain newbies, experts and all those in between are welcome! As are men!

For this upcoming event we will be interviewing, Mia Mohamed from Trustology, a crypto custodianship service provider; and Victoria Clarke, Crypto Divorce Lawyer.

I will discuss with them why they got into Blockchain; how they got started, their area of expertise and any advice they'd give to women wanting to create their place in this new and burgeoning industry.

Women in Blockchain Talks aims to elevate women working, investing and creating solutions on the blockchain. To inspire and motivate other women wanting to start a career in Blockchain and how they can get started.

Women in Blockchain Talks introduces women to blockchain technology through networking, and the social but intimate art of conversation via a lively and engaging interview hosted by Lavinia D. Osbourne.

Lavinia has a history of creating platforms and events around women empowerment be it from the successfully ran events Infinitely Wealthy Women to the one-off controversial but also successful event 'Bitcoins, Blockchain & Babes'.

Blockchain is gender-neutral but society isn't! So, through these monthly events, we hope to inject the industry with diversity and inclusion by shining a spotlight on a diverse range of 'up and coming,' as well as established, female leaders. (If you are interested in being a guest or know someone who should get in contact!)

So, join us on Wednesday 22nd January 2020 at ConsenSys, to share knowledge and experiences. This is a supportive environment to learn, connect and ask questions.

Warm regards,
Lavinia
Founder & Host of WiB Talks
Blockchain Influencer & Enthusiast
